campaign.story:
What is THE HATED?
Equal parts spaghetti western and blaxploitation thriller, THE HATED is a new comic book written by David F. Walker, drawn by Sean Damien Hill, colored by Mx. Struble, lettered by Becca Carey, and published by Solid Comix.
THE HATED cover art by Sean Damien Hill with colors by Mx. Struble
It is 1872, and the war between the North and South is over. Neither side won. After years of bloody conflict, both sides entered into a truce, resulting in the formation of two nations, the Union States of America, where blacks are free, and the Confederate States of America, where blacks are still enslaved. Araminta Free is a former slave turned bounty hunter. She specializes in crossing the border into the Confederacy, and liberating slaves. She also tracks down Confederate war criminals, which has made her a woman with a price on her head in the southern nation. When a group of Confederate Raiders illegally ventures deep into the Union to kidnap free blacks and sell them into slavery, the stage is set for a deadly showdown between Araminta and the men who want her dead.
Imagine if director Sergio Corbucci (DJANGO, THE GREAT SILENCE) made a western starring Pam Grier as a badass, gun-slinging bounty hunter. Now imagine the story takes place in a world where the Civil War ended differently – instead of a victory for the North, there is a truce, and what had been one country is now two. This is THE HATED.
The first issue of THE HATED is 100% drawn and inked, and is currently being colored. Here are some samples of the amazing work by artist Sean Damien Hill and colorist Mx. Struble.
WHAT ARE YOU FUNDING?
This campaign is funding the first issue of THE HATED, a mini-series written and published by David F. Walker, drawn by Sean Damien Hill, colored by Shaun Struble, and lettered by Becca Carey. This will be a full color, 40-page comic book plus cover.
30 pages of story
10  back-up pages
Standard sized comic
The purpose of this campaign is to fund the production and printing of THE HATED #1, fulfill all backer rewards, and cover the cost of shipping and handling for all reward tiers. Because THE HATED is more pages than ONE FALL, the cost of printing and shipping is more, for that reason, we have set our goal higher this time. But all of the money is going towards the costs of producing and delivering all rewards, any remaining/extra funds will go toward the production of THE HATED #2.
WHY KICKSTARTER?
We wanted the freedom to create a series on our own terms, and at a pace that works for our schedules. The first issue of THE HATED is drawn, inked, and partially colored and lettered. By the time this campaign is over, the first issue will be 100% complete and ready to go to print. The money raised from this campaign will go to fund printing and productions costs of the first issue of THE HATED, production of other rewards, and shipping. Any money raised over the target goal will be used as seed money for the second issue of THE HATED.

THE HATED #1 - We've got some great rewards for this campaign, starting the the comic itself. You will have a choice of a digital comic or a physical copy. There are multiple options for covers of the physical copy, including the main Cover, and the variant Cover B (image only, no text). 
THE HATED #1 - David Mack Variant Cover - since a picture is worth 1,000 words, we'll just show it to you...
David Mack variant cover
THE HATED #1 Black and White Limited Edition - Solid Comix is pleased to offer a limited edition, black and white version of THE HATED #1. This is the exact same comic as the color edition, only without the color. This edition will have a limited print run for Kickstarter. There will be no second printing. The black and white edition will only be available here on Kickstarter (and at conventions if any are left) -- no digital copies, not available online, and no retailer copies. Once these are gone, they are gone. 
pages from the Black and White Limited Edition
 KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE!!! This amazing sticker (2"x3") featuring Araminta Free is included with all physical copies. Not available anywhere else, this is special thanks to everyone supporting Solid Comix and THE HATED. 
KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE!!!
BadAzz MoFo's Book of SPAGHETTI WESTERNS by David F. Walker - every order of THE HATED comes with this FREE digital of David F. Walker's book about spaghetti westerns, reprinted from the pages of his 'zine BadAzz MoFo. This digital book features reviews of more than 40 films and a historic overview of the Eurowestern genre -- 114 pages, including reviews of DJANGO, THE GREAT SILENCE, A BULLET FOR THE GENERAL, and many more. This is special thanks to everyone supporting Solid Comix and THE HATED.
ADD-ONS
The Joelle Jones 8.5”x11” pin-up is now available as an add-on to all print copy reward tiers for $10 each (sorry, not available with digital only). This was supposed to be the $20k stretch goal...but since we likely won't hit that goal, and since this is such an amazing work or art, and because I appreciated all the support everyone has shown to this campaign, it is being made available. 
To add the pin-up to your existing reward tier click the “Manage your pledge” button (it should be on the right side of your screen). This will take to a page called “Change Your Pledge.” Change the “PLEDGE AMOUNT” to reflect the adding of the pin-up or any other add-ons. EXAMPLE: If you pledge $8 to get a print copy of Cover A and you want to add the Joelle Jones, you would add $10, making your new pledge amount $28.
Joelle Jones 8.5"x11" pin-up
MORE ADD-ONS
ANOTHER NEW TIER!!!
We’ve just added a very special reward tier. Let’s call it the “I Love Indie Comics” tier. This is a special bundle that includes The Hated #1 (Cover A) along with three indies titles that I really like – Harriett Tubman: Demon Slayer #1, Crescent City Monsters#1, and Is’Nana the Were-Spider: The Ballads of Rawhead & John Henry.  All three are comic projects they I have backed on Kickstarter, and I want to share them with a select group of backers. You get physical copies of all four of these comics for $20, as well as the Kickstarter Exclusive Stickers and a PDF of BadAzz MoFo’s Book of Spaghetti Westerns. Limited to only 10!!!
 NEW TIERS ADDED!!! (UPDATE - All gone!!!)
I’m very happy to announce two new reward tiers. I have a limited number of BITTER ROOT #6 variant covers – both the ‘Do the Right Thing’ tribute cover and the ‘My Neighbor Totoro’ tribute cover. Both are extremely rare, and going for upwards of $100 on eBay. I have eight copies of each cover, and once they are gone, they are gone. This reward tier includes ONE copy of BITTER ROOT #6 (either the ‘Do the Right Thing’ cover or the ‘Totoro’ cover), a printed copy of THE HATED #1 (Cover A), Kickstarter Exclusive Sticker, and Free PDF of BadAzz MoFo’s Book of SPAGHETTI WESTERNS.
SORRY...All of these rewards are gone.
$20k Stretch Goal -- Joelle Jones 8.5"x11" pin-up, colored by Mx. Struble. 
This pin-up will be available as an add-on with print copies of THE HATED #1





THE CREATORS
David F. Walker - writer/publisher
 DAVID F. WALKER is the co-creator of BITTER ROOT (Image) NAOMI (DC) and  author of THE LIFE OD FREDERICK DOUGLASS (Ten Speed). He has written for Marvel, Dark Horse, BOOM!, and Dynamite.
Sean Damien Hill - artist
 SEAN DAMIEN HILL is an illustrator of comics, graphic novels, who also dabbles in the realm of concept art, character design and graphic design.
Mx. Struble - colorist
MX. STRUBLE is a writer and colorist working out of Dallas. In their free time, they like to make musi
Becca Carey - letterer/designer
 BECCA CAREY is a designer and illustrator with a penchant for the handmade approach.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While there are risks and challenges involved with any Kickstarter campaign, THE HATED runs very little risk of hitting any problems. The art is complete, and the budget has been calculated to cover all costs, including shipping. Our first campaign for ONE FALL was successful, it came in on budget, and rewards were sent ahead of schedule.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
I've heard from some of you that your rewards never showed up. Replacements are going out in the mail this week. Now, if I may vent for a moment...
As many of you know, the United States Post Office has been facing difficult times, due in no small part to efforts to dismantle that agency. At the risk of getting too political, the damage wrought on the USPS by the Trump administration has been mind-boggling. I have been using the post office as my main source of business shipping for more than 25 years. In that time, I've had more problems in the last six months than in all those years combined. There have been more copies of The Hated that have simply disappeared than anything else I've ever shipped. In most cases, tracking shows that these packages were delivered, even though they weren't. And only a small handful have been returned. Who knows what happened to all of them?

updates.update_userinfo: Last Call for Reward Surveys in 2020!!!
updates.update_content:
There are still a few of you that have not filled out reward surveys, as well as a few of you who just filled it out within the last few weeks. Backers who recently filled out the survey, your rewards will be shipping within the upcoming week.
The deadline for filling out a reward survey AND getting your rewards shipped to you in 2020 is Monday, November 30, 2020. I will still ship rewards in 2021, but not until after the new year.
As of now, ALL rewards have been shipped that can be shipped. What does that mean? Well...if you have not received your rewards, it is either because you haven't filled out a reward survey OR your package was lost in the mail. Please contact me via direct message if you have not received your rewards.

UPDATE: Okay...I've checked the status on every reward package that has been sent out. Of the 900+ packages that have been sent out to folks in the United States, there are exactly 15 that have not been delivered. Some were sent Priority, some were sent Media Mail, and according to the Unites States Postal Service, all are still in transit...though all are delayed for reasons unknown. I'm preparing to send out new packages to the 15 of you still waiting. My only hesitation is that I suspect the new packages will take as long as the initial packages. That said, if a reward package isn't delivered this week, I'll start sending replacements over the weekend. I'm sorry this has taken so long.

I know some of you are frustrated that your rewards have not arrived yet. Trust me, I'm frustrated too. Without getting into politics (or political conspiracies), the United States Postal Service is a mess at the moment. Just do a Google search of "USPS delays" and you'll see what's going on. At the moment, there are about 20 packages that have not been delivered in the United States, which is down from more than 30 last week -- so they are getting delivered. Foreign deliveries have started arriving, primarily in Canada (which is surprising). For those of you waiting on your rewards, please, be patient. I am checking the tracking every day.

updates.update_userinfo: THE HATED #1 is now available to everyone!!!
updates.update_content:
We now have a store where you can buy both physical copies and PDF copies of THE HATED!!!
https://gumroad.com/solidcomix

Several people have reached out to inquire about their rewards. All rewards have been shipped to backers who provided their mailing address before July 23rd. If you provided your address after the 23rd, it has not yet shipped. Here is what I can tell you about orders that HAVE NOT ARRIVED...
Between July 10th and 12th, I shipped over 300 reward packages. Approximately 40 of those have not been delivered yet. I've checked the tracking, and most appear to have been delayed at mail processing facilities in either Portland or Seattle. All are currently "in transit." If you live in the United States and still have NOT received your rewards by the end of this week, please email me directly.

Hey folks, everyone outside of the United States waiting for me to come up with a creative way to handle the unexpectedly high cost of shipping, I've come up with the solution...I paid the postage rates (it's only money). Honestly, I could've flown to Europe, and hand-delivered comics for about the same money. I was actually supposed to do a book tour in France this summer, and I could've made trips to several other countries to deliver comics in person...but the damn pandemic ruined everything!!!
Speaking of the pandemic...I hope you all are doing your best to stay safe and healthy.

updates.update_userinfo: Attention Backers OUTSIDE of the United States!!! (and Damaged Copies!!!)
updates.update_content:
If you are a backer outside of the United States, I have sent you a private email to the address you provided. If you don't see it in your inbox, please check your spam folders.
The problem I am currently having is related to shipping costs. The cost of shipping two comics plus pin-ups and stickers to most countries in Europe is $11.26. The cost of shipping three comics plus pin-ups and stickers is $24.40, and the cost of shipping four comics is even more. The cost difference has to do with weight restrictions. I am working on a solution, and will have this all figured out in a few days. Thank you for your patience.

updates.update_userinfo: Missing Rewards & Damaged Copies & Foreign Orders
updates.update_content:
MISSING REWARDS - Hey everyone, now is the time that rewards should be showing up. I've checked the tracking numbers on a bunch of packages, and some have yet to be delivered. If you are in the U.S. and your reward package has not shown up by July 23rd, send me a message.
DAMAGED COPIES - If your rewards were severely damaged in the mail, please let me know, and I can replace it*. It has come to my attention that some copies of the comic that shipped were damaged prior to being sent (this was something that occurred at the printer). I will replace these as well. Just message me.

If you are a backer who lives outside the United States, I wanted to share this update. Because of COVID-19, the United States Postal Service has implemented various new policies for mail leaving the U.S. It is my understanding that USPS is no longer taking paper customs forms, but the website is for electronic forms is inaccessible. All of this is to say that there will be a delay in shipping foreign orders. I hope to have everything resolved within the next few days. Thanks for your patience.

campaign.story:
UPDATE: RELATABLE CONTENT IS HAPPENING! AND MORE!
 WE ARE MAKING AN ALBUM AND DOING A TOUR!!! Thanks to your help this is a reality, but there are still some cool things we could do if we make these STRETCH GOALS!
PATCHES AND STICKERS!
Hello! We're The PDX Broadsides — Hollyanna, Jessica, and Christian — and we're a nerd-pop trio with tight harmonies and clever lyrics about fandom and feelings and things we love. We're from Portland, Oregon (aka PDX to locals) and we have been playing music together since 2011. Formed accidentally (and earning our name) by singing acapella sea shanties in public (oops), we soon branched out into our own original nerdtastic compositions.  Over time our songs have become more vulnerable and we're grateful that our audiences have responded so well to that openness - this is the most vulnerable album yet and we know you'll love this RELATABLE CONTENT.
You may have seen us performing with some other talented folks, like The Doubleclicks (we're signed to Doubleclicks Records), Marian Call, Misbehavin' Maidens, Molly Lewis, and Professor Shyguy, to name a few. Some of those stages include Dragon Con in Atlanta (where we're honored to return for a second year in a row in 2019 as a House Band!), Rose City Comic Con, Emerald City Comic Con, and comic book shops, science museums, and more across the US and Canada.      
We're also on the internet. We make videos, are enthusiastic Tweeters, and have been featured places like Geek In The City Radio and The Mary Sue.   
"The PDX Broadsides sing what we're all thinking" - The Mary Sue
"...toe-tapping rhythms and charming harmonies..." - GeekDad
"The band has always made music that resonates" - Geek Hard
To date, we've released four studio albums (take a listen for free on Bandcamp!): "Take Everything," "Aim To Misbehave," "Something's Rotten," and "Trust Issues," and we're ready, with your help, to make #5: "RELATABLE CONTENT."
To cut straight to the point: we're making 1) our fifth studio album + 2) our first East Coast tour.  
When we started talking about making a new album, the songs that we chose naturally progressed the same ideas as on our last album: we're still facing the dragons, and sometimes we still don't win, but we're trying to be braver. We see the mistakes we make and we're finding ways to do better, in a world that continually finds ways to challenge us.
Oh, there's also buffalo and books and Steven Universe. We're still nerdy as heck, friends, and there's a lot of fun and upbeat stuff on here, too, we promise!
"Relatable Content" has the songs that have resonated with our audiences and us over the past two years, and we're ready to have them in your ears and on the road.
We've made a lot of friends and fans over the years and we'd like to play with and for them more places. We've been asked repeatedly to come to the East Coast and we think we're ready as a band after our years of experience to finally do that. Did you know touring is expensive? It's hecking expensive, friends. We could use a boost.
We believe in Kickstarting to do something NEW and BIGGER, and with that firmly in our hearts, we’re asking you to help us reach the next stage... figuratively AND literally.
Album!!!
Let's talk album. 13 full-length tracks, each one something we know you're gonna love. Oh, and this album is definitely family-friendly! 
 "The Alligators" - the little lies that eat at us and keep us from being our best (featuring cello by Betsy Tinney!)
 "Buffalo" - a very silly song about consent and poor decisions
 "Heartless" - love will drive you insane, let the Queen of Hearts tell you, buddy (inspired by Marissa Meyer's novel "Heartless")
 "Let The Wild Rumpus Start" - let's go have fun and all be monsters together! (inspired by Maurice Sendak's "Where The Wild Things Are")
 "Serotonin Dopamine"- we miss those neurotransmitters when they're gone
 "Rewind" - ever wish you could just start a conversation over?
 "Orpheus" - when fight or flight fails, sometimes you freeze. #MeToo meets the Greeks. (with bass by Chris Waffle!)
 "Lost At Sea" - get ghosted by a friend? need to cut someone from your life? let them go. 
 "Together Breakfast" - we really like brunch and friends. (inspired by Steven Universe, includes clarinet by Dr. Mary Crowell!)
 "Winter is Coming" - Arya Stark is not having it, y'all (inspired by George RR Martin's "Game of Thrones")
In addition, 3 of the songs from the album were inspired by YOU, the fans! Thanks to custom reward backers, we developed these songs that were so good that the rest of the world really needs to hear them.
 "Jerkbrain" - brains are jerks, but good friends are not
 "House of the Wind" - how does it feel to step on stage and perform? Equal parts scary and THE ABSOLUTE BEST (inspired by Patrick Rothfuss' "The Kingkiller Chronicles")
 "Love Good" - loyalty, honesty, and whimsy make Luna Lovegood a steadfast friend to have (inspired by J.K. Rowling's "Harry Potter" series)
We wrote all of these and every track will have guitar, piano, and our signature harmonies, plus some special add-ins. We're once again working with Kevin Hahn of Opal Studio to record, mix, and master (he also did "Something's Rotten" and "Trust Issues"!) so you know this is going to be magnificent.  
Tour!!!
This is our current path, starting in Raleigh! The sooner we fund, the sooner we can confirm stops!
Our plan would be to tour the East Coast October 4-13 with stops in Raleigh, the Washington D.C. area, Philadelphia, Brooklyn, Newark, and Boston. We do have openings for a couple more shows which we could definitely fill in with house concerts (contact us if that's you and you want to back us for the house concert level!!!). The moment we fund, we can confirm our venues and possibly add additional shows.
UPDATE: Current Shows (more info and tix soon!)
10/4: House Concert; Raleigh, NC (with Juliana Finch)
10/6: New Deal Cafe; Greenbelt, MD (with Misbehavin' Maidens!)
10/9: The Way Station; Brooklyn, NY (with guests TBA!)
10/12: The ONCE Lounge; Somerville, MA (with Sarah Donner!)
Part of the joy of touring is getting to play with some of the friends we've made over the last few years. Our live shows are not just musical performances - somehow they turn into comedy routines as well, and even we don't know what's going to happen. That's part of what makes touring so much fun. We even stay friends the whole time!
We've crunched the numbers, and we know how much money it will take to not only record and produce an album, but also travel across the country and tour. It's more than we've got, but we know that there are friends and fans out there who really get what we do. They want to be a part of this crazy music thing that we do, and they want to hear new music. 
That's where Kickstarter comes in. Our previous campaign for the "Trust Issues" album was overwhelmingly successful, and allowed us to bring the CD to life. In return, our backers got to be a part of that process and get their hands on some of our best work so far. They also were able to get new stickers, t-shirts, and even brand new songs just for them. Everyone got what they wanted, and Kickstarter made that process very easy. 
This time around, there's even more on the table - we're taking more time on the recording of "Relatable Content," and mounting our most ambitious tour yet. We know there's no way we're going to be successful unless we have your help to put it together.
We have some really cool rewards available, including a new 4-STICKER PACK, USB DISCOGRAPHY, and our first-ever ENAMEL PINS! 
THE ALBUM:
Digital downloads of the album will delivered to Kickstarter backers a day or more before the rest of the world gets it. Most likely, the album will reach you via a download code for Bandcamp. Physical CDs will come by post!
We're excited to announce that our album art is by Aud Koch! She is an amazing illustrator who's worked on comics for Dark Horse and Marvel. Her work on The Wicked + The Divine: 1923 inspired the direction for "Relatable Content"'s cover! It's got elements of Alice in Wonderland and some familiar beasties. We think you're going to love it AND you can get art prints of it (see below!)
Art Prints:
Brand new for this campaign, we're making beautiful 12" x 12" art prints of two of our album covers: the "Trust Issues" cover done by Benjamin Dewey (The Autumnlands, Beasts of Burden), and our new "Relatable Content" cover by Aud Koch (The Wicked + The Divine: 1923).
[L]: Relatable Content cover by Aud Koch. [R]: Trust Issues cover by Benjamin Dewey. Both available as art prints for this campaign!
Stickers:
Our four-sticker pack will bring you die-cut vinyl stickers for you to place on your car, your travel mug, your little brother... the possibilities are endless! Includes art from our own Hollyanna McCollom, German artist Jela Schmidt, and Portland artist Jesse Miller!
Stickers will be roughly 3" square.

Enamel Pins:
We finally made the leap and designed some enamel pins - they are so cool! Put them on your jacket, bag, lanyard, or decorative frame! Featuring Jela Schmidt's "I Can't Even" octopus and our ever-popular "Smile!" button. Pins will be approximately 1.5" in diameter. Working out the area will be left as an exercise for the reader.
Actual pins may include glitter!
USB Discography:
USB sticks with all of our albums in digital format, plus some rare unreleased tracks! These have been a favorite with new fans who want to binge-listen. Also great for folks who don't want to stack up CDs!
Your USB will arrive signed on the clever tag!
Art Prints:
Brand new for this campaign, we're making beautiful 12" x 12" art prints of two of our album covers: the "Trust Issues" cover done by Benjamin Dewey (The Autumnlands, Beasts of Burden), and our new "Relatable Content" cover by Aud Koch (The Wicked + The Divine: 1923).
What if I want MOAR STUFF?
You want additional pins, previous albums or shirts, more USBs? No problem. After the campaign, we will be using Backerkit in order to let you add as many additional things you need for you and your discerning crew... but we have to reach that base goal first.
Unique Rewards:
In addition to physical rewards, we have some SPECIAL opportunities:
HOT SEAT: We'll reserve excellent seats for you and three of your friends at one of our shows! We'll dedicate a song to you, include you in an audience interaction bit, and more... or just wave hello and respectfully let you enjoy your seats. We get it, introverts, you can enjoy nerd music too. [Venue restrictions may apply. We'll contact you at close of campaign to make arrangements.]
TOGETHER BREAKFAST: We'll take you and a friend out to brunch in Portland, OR where you can ask us all your burning questions and we'll be ridiculous Muppets together. Multiple spots are available, but we won't take more than 3 pairs out with us at a time for maximum Broadsides exposure. Multiple brunches for us! [Does not include transport or lodging, just brunch and hangout. We will arrange dates with backers at the close of campaign.]
CUSTOM JINGLE/SONG: Ever want your own theme song? Writing a novel or need an intro song for a podcast? Really think we should write [SONG] about [THING]? Here's your shot. We send a survey at conclusion of campaign and work with you to write that song. Bonus: you might hear that song at our next show or on our next album!  [We retain all rights to the songs, song to be used for personal or Broadsides-approved non-personal uses.]
HOUSE CONCERT: Let us play for you! We'll do an hourish of music for you and your pals. You provide the house and a space big enough for the three of us with piano and guitar, and we'll fill it with the nerdy songs you love. [Please contact us before choosing this option for arrangements! For locations more than 100 miles from Portland, there is an additional charge for travel and lodging which we'll work out with you!]
Here's where your backer money will be used! You can see that TOURING is EXPENSIVE, and we appreciate every dollar that gets us closer to fulfilling these goals.
There's nothing quite like being a part of a community. We all share so much - we have bad days, we have good days, we're scared, we're happy... These experiences are what connect us, and with "Relatable Content" we are putting down in song some of the things we can all relate to. Your support means the world to us, and inspires us to create more for you. 
Special thanks to Laser Malena-Webber of Laser Campaigns for their help in wrangling this all together, to Benja Barker, Ryan Scott, Godiva Lee, and Nate Ayling for making our Kickstarter video, to Kevin Hahn of Opal Studio for recording us, and to Kara Helgren for taking wonderful pictures of us at The Nerd Out.
THANK YOU SO MUCH!
-- Christian, Hollyanna, and Dr. Jessica
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our second Kickstarter. Our previous one, for the album "Trust Issues," produced a great CD on time. This time we are dedicating twice as much time to the studio so that we can really stretch out and create without as much pressure.

The big difference this time is that there is a tour attached, and tours come with their own unique challenges. What if things cost more than we expect? We've worked out a detailed budget that builds in a reasonable buffer for financial variance. The tour is not scheduled until late in the year and we're already in contact with several venues. We have been on tours before and we feel confident that we are well-prepared to fulfill all aims.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
FIELD NOTES: An Ecological Journal of Nature's Marvels is my take on the nature diaries of explorers in previous generations. In the same way those naturalists would explore new frontiers and carefully illustrate their findings, FIELD NOTES is a collection of my sketches, paintings and notes on the behavior of remarkable creatures in the wild. The animals are re-imaginings of characters you'll recognize from across the DC and Marvel universes, along with other favorites like the Ninja Turtles. The book is meant to be tongue-in-cheek, while still being a great showcase for the real-life animals these characters are based on. I hope to capture the wonder of exploration, even if it's just finding size-changing ants or leather-wearing house cats in your own backyard.  
This book collects my work on this project from 2015-2019, including over 100 oil, watercolor, and digital paintings along with pencil sketches. Though comics have an immense number of characters to reference, this book is as comprehensive as possible. Dozens of characters are spread out over 70+ full-color pages. So, from the flora and fauna of Gotham City, or the spider species of New York, to the grasslands of Wakanda, this book will be a visual guide for all the creatures you might encounter.
Full-bleed oil and watercolor paintings allow you to see these creatures up close.
Color studies and quick pencil sketches illustrate each sighting.
Scale charts describe entire families of creatures, and maps tell you where to find them.
Now let's make it happen!
FIELD NOTES will now be printed at 9"x12"! A HUGE increase from the original size!

Each pledge helps to improve the quality of the book for everyone, and make this a beautiful showpiece for your collection.

updates.update_content:
Thank you all so much! 
It was a crazy October-December getting all of the copies of FIELD NOTES: An Ecological Journal of Nature's Marvels out the door and into your homes. The longest part of the process was completeing the dozens of inside cover drawings and commisions that many of you earned as additional pledge rewards. But as of now, the last copies have arrived and this Kickstarter is officially complete!

We finally have all of the books done and delivered from the printer! I can't say how exciting it was to get an entire truckload of FIELD NOTES: An Ecological Journal of Nature's Marvels loaded into my garage. It came in 26 boxes and weighed about 1,000 pounds. We'd had a partial delivery the week before for Portland's Rose City Comicon, where I was able to speak with some of you and hand off your copy face-to-face. Thank you for coming by our booth and saying hello! For everyone else, Wren and I have had a few nights of "packing parties" already, where we prepare as many books for shipping as we can at a time. The first batches have been mailed off and should be arriving in the coming week. The rest are hot on their heels and will be shipped in more batches in the coming days. Watch out for that hitting your mailbox soon.

updates.update_userinfo: Will You Be At Rose City?
updates.update_content:
A backer brought up a very good point yesterday. I'll have a table at Rose City Comic Con in Portland, Oregon, September 13-15. So if you are attending that con, PLEASE let me know! I can have your book and rewards ready to go, and I can hand them off to you in person. Please comment on this update or message me if you'll be at the show and would like to have a pick-up ready at my table. Please let me know by this Friday, September 6 so that I have time to put that together for you.
Cheers!

Hi there! Thank you all for your support and patience through this project! 
The books are completely printed and just finishing up at the bindery in Kent, Washington. I'm including some images of the prototype I approved earlier in the month. It was great to look through a real physical version for the first time (and to let them know they'd put in a spread upside-down...) You might notice that the foil stamp title hasn't been applied yet, but it is now being applied to the bound final copies that are coming off the line.

It's off! Last week I was able to deliver completed files to the printer. It was a group effort, thank you to the many people who were proofing rounds of the book all the way up to the last moment. I'm really proud of the end result. It was a BEAST to finish, but that is because the final book turned out to be even more ambitious than I had expected when this Kickstarter began. I promised 70 pages and finished almost 90. 
More good news! Based on the number of generous backers on this project, we were able to print locally. I'd initially thought we would need to use a foreign printer, which would have been less expensive but also made controlling the quality of the book very difficult. Instead, I'm able to use an extremely high-quality printer in the Sodo area of Seattle. I expect to review physical proofs of the book this week. This will be wonderful, since I can make sure that the artwork is being reproduced perfectly and can address any issues with the print team. Then it will go on to be bound in Kent, Washington, just a few minutes away.

updates.update_userinfo: Progress Report (Spoiler, there's been a ton!)
updates.update_content: I wanted to give you all a shout to let you know how things are going! Since my last update I was able to take two weeks of vacation time from my job to work solely on this project 24/7. That time was extremely valuable, since this project has always depended on scrounging hours over nights and weekends. In those two weeks I was able to complete more than I normally could in a few months. The book's final structure really took shape, and since coming away from that focused retreat, I feel like we're on the down-slope toward completion. Aside from painting tons of new material, I'm especially proud to have a completed cover. We've started working with our printer to choose our stock and finishes, and so far I have physical samples of many interior pages and the cover ready and approved.

Thank you for making this pre-sale campaign so successful. We've fully funded every one of our stretch goals, and now have everything we need to make FIELD NOTES a gorgeous addition to your collection. Please be sure to fill out the survey link I sent if you haven't already. This gives me the information I need to ship your copy of the book and to start working on your rewards. Most of you have responded already, and I'm really excited to get down to work on your extras and commissions.
First though, I need to finish the book! Estimated delivery is sometime in August, which gives me six more weeks until I have to send everything over to our printer. In the meantime I'm putting every minute into finishing additional pages. I wanted to update you with a peek at some of the work from just the last couple of weeks:

The Kickstarter ends tomorrow and I just wanted to take a minute to thank you for backing this project and talk about what comes next. The book has transformed over the last month, getting better as we hit each stretch goal. What was initially a handy volume has become a substantial art book, and I couldn’t be more proud and grateful. I’m glad that we’ll be able to make everyone’s copy at a level of quality that would have been impossible without your awesome response. That said, there’s still another day, so hopefully we can make sure everyone who wants a copy can get one when we start to ship them out!

Hello everyone!
My editor and collaborator, Wren, and I have been pricing out options with our printer, and there are now enough backers that we can increase the size of the book again! 
After hitting the second stretch goal of $6,000 we were able to go up from our original size of 6"x9" to 7.75"x9.75." That might not sound like a huge change, but it already made a big difference visually. We were pinning down those details and thinking about the next stretch goal when we realized that we've already raised enough to go up in size again, this time to 9"x12." As you can see in the graphic below, this is a HUGE upgrade. Along with the upgrade to hardcover, the book has now officially gone from a handy volume to a large coffee table showpiece.

campaign.story:
Professional wrestling is real. So are werewolves, vampires, and really greedy promoters that will stop at nothing to make a dollar.  
Jimmy “Resurrecter” King, is a third generation wrestler dealing with the curse of his family – every time he is killed in the ring, he comes back to life. As if that wasn’t bad enough, now the Resurrecter must fight not only for his life, but also for his family, as he is forced to compete in the deadly Continental Gauntlet.
ONE FALL is loaded with action, drama, dark comedy, and tons of wrestling.

One Fall #1 Mock Cover (not final)


One Fall, Page 2
One Fall, Page 3
 WHAT ARE YOU FUNDING? 
This campaign is funding the first issue of ONE FALL, a five-issue series written and published by David F. Walker and drawn by Brett Weldele. This will be a full color, 32-page comic book with 24 pages of main story, and a back-up feature by writer Ted Pirro. 
Our goal will cover the following:
Production - Comics and Art Prints
Supplies - Pages, etc. 
Shipping/Shipping Supplies
Marketing for One Fall and Solid Comix

WHY KICKSTARTER?
We wanted the freedom to create a series on our own terms, and at a pace that works for our schedules. The first issue of ONE FALL is drawn, inked, and partially colored and lettered. By the time this campaign is over, we will have the first issue 100% in the can and ready to go to print. The money raised from this campaign will go to fund printing of the first issue of ONE FALL, production of other rewards, and shipping. Any money raised over the target goal will be used to help offset the cost of creating the first issue (which we all did for free), and as seed money for the second issue. In addition, we are hoping to continue to spread the word about SOLID COMIX!
PLAY


WHO WE ARE
David F. Walker -- writer and co-creator of ONE FALL. David is co-creator of BITTER ROOT (Image) and NAOMI (DC), and has worked for Marvel (POWER MAN & IRON FIST, NIGHTHAWK, LUKE CAGE), Boom (PLANET OF THE APES: URSUS), and Dynamite (SHAFT).
Writer David F. Walker
Brett Weldele -- artist and co-creator of ONE FALL. Brett is the artist and co-creator of THE SURROGATES (Top Shelf), THE LIGHT (Image), and SOUTHLAND TALES (Graphitti). 
Artist Brett Weldele
Ted Pirro – writer and creative consultant on ONE FALL. Ted is writing all of the back-up stories for the series. 


SNEAK PEEKS FROM THE LOCKER ROOM

Brett Weldele 5.5 x 8.5 inch Art Prints
 "Bitter Root" (2nd Print) Issue #1 & "Naomi" Issue #1 

"The Army of Dr. Moreau" & "The Light"

STRETCH GOALS!!!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every creative projects has risks, but thankfully with One Fall we avoided the biggest risks of all by waiting until we had most of the book done. As of right now, the first issue of One Fall is completely drawn and inked, and Brett has colored almost half of the pages. We will be 100% done with One Fall #1 by the time this campaign ends, which means the first issue will be going to press no later than April. We have set the targeted release date for June 2019, though we are hoping to fulfill most rewards by May 2019.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: If you haven't received your reward yet, please take time to complete the reward survey. We need the completed surveys so we know where to send you rewards. Thanks.

Most backer rewards have been shipped. The exceptions are foreign order, retailers, and anyone who hasn't filled out a reward survey. Retailers and foreign orders will go out within the next week or so. An email has been sent with a link to the PDF of ONE FALL #1. 
As always, thanks for your support.

There was a delay at the printer, and then I was out of town for a convention, but as of right now, ONE FALL #1 is done! I'll pick up the books from the printer on Monday or Tuesday, and start processing orders later in the week.

ONE FALL #1 is ready to go to press. We're just waiting for some of you to finish your reward surveys, so that we know what name to put on the "Thank You" page (as well as where we need to send your rewards). If you haven't filled out your reward survey yet, please do so. Thanks.

Thanks to all of the backers and those of you that helped spread the word. Here's a quick update, so you know where things are... 
Brett and I are finalizing the back-up pages for ONE FALL #1. Brett is leaving for C2E2 on Thursday, March 21st. I'm leaving for Wondercon the following week. Our plan is to wrap up all the last minute production stuff by the week of April 8th, and have the first issue off to the printer shortly thereafter. We're looking to have the first wave of rewards in the mail by late April or early May.

Several retailers have reached out to me and pointed out that the RETAILERS PACKAGE Tier is a bit cost prohibitive. I'm still figuring out the magic of Kickstarter, and want to make sure that I do right by retailers. Because of the way Kickstarter is set up, I can't change the reward tier. That said, I will be making the following adjustments once the RETAILERS PACKAGE rewards ship...
- All of the RETAILERS PACKAGE level rewards will be increased from 7 copies of ONE FALL to 10 copies. This will lower your cost to $3.50 per unit.

I'm pleased to announce that Brett has finished coloring ONE FALL #1. We are right on schedule to have the book off to the printer by the end of the month, and rewards shopping by early May. Thank you to everyone who has backed this project and spread the word. We still have two weeks left -- let's keep moving forward. Thanks.

campaign.story:
From the age of 3, my daughter has been telling me about different wonderful creatures she made up that exist on a planet called Numquamori. The specificity, detail, and imaginative nature of these animals fascinated me, and I sought to write down everything I could about my growing daughter's magical world. Here I have compiled a bestiary of 30 of the animals, along with a brief history of the creation of the planet Numquamori, and some natural history of the land and sea. 
This book is a labor of love, something I wanted to make as a dedication to not only my daughter's imagination, but also as a reminder to myself that I also had this kind of boundless creativity as a child, and had forgotten it. In printing this book and allowing the public access to the world of Numquamori, I hope that other people may find inspiration as well to tap into their own wild imaginations and dare to create their own wondrous worlds.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All of the artwork for the book is complete, as is the editing and formatting. All we need is to print and ship! The pins and magnets for the tier that those apply to are also in my possession, and just await the printing of the books. I will keep all backers informed through the printing and shipping process as things progress. I've tried to keep this campaign as simple as possible, and have worked on the artwork and writing for 2 years to make sure everything was finished on my end before I set up the Kickstarter.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hello Backers!
I’m going to be sending out those that backed at the level with original artwork at the end of this month/beginning of August. I still have a few other tiers that I am waiting for surveys back for, and I would love it if you have not received your book to just check your emails to make sure you sent a reply to my survey. I really want to get these books and prizes to you, but can’t if I don’t have a good address for you!

Al the payments have been processed, officially, and I just put in a big order of books at the printer! I'm so excited to get this out to you all. I've also got all of the magnet and pin combo packages ready to go, just waiting for those books to come my way, and for me to sign them for those at the $35.00 and over levels. Be sure to get the surveys back to me that include the shipping address you want to send things to, and I;ll ship them as soon as I can! Thank you all for your support!

The Beasts of Numquamori Kickstarter has ended and I am so, so, so grateful for all of you that shared and supported this project! I am humbled at the response and could not be happier with this project’s success. I couldn’t have done it without all of you! THANK YOU!

campaign.story:
Cube of Smoke (CoS) is a unique product that provides a great way to enhance cocktails with the flavor of natural hardwood smoke.
Using Smoke is a popular way to bring excitement to craft cocktails while enhancing the guest experience and the flavor of their favorite beverage.
Perfecting the Cube of Smoke Experience is Simple.  First, select Your Hardwood Cube
Red Oak, Maple, Hickory and Cherry Hardwood Cubes
Each Hardwood Cube (dimension 1.75" / 44.4mm) and is cut by hand from All-natural, un-treated hardwood that's sustain-ably harvested in North America.  
Red Oak's rich flavor is great for whiskey cocktails like the Old Fashioned.
Maple's smoke is balanced and adds a sweetness to cocktails, and is a surprising compliment to cold brew coffee. 
Hickory's full bodied flavor is a perfect blend with Bourbon. Neat or on the rocks, Hickory Smoke enhances and adds complexity to any cocktail.
Cherry's sweet and mild flavor goes with virtually everything but is a standout with vermouth cocktails like the Manhattan, and the Negroni.
Choose your Glass
You can use Cube of Smoke to add the flavor of natural Hardwood Smoke to cocktails using the following types of Glassware.
Lowball, Boston Shaker, Mixing Glass or Cloche
A Lowball Glass for single cocktails
A Boston Shaker for shaken or rolled cocktails
A Mixing Glass for stirred cocktails, making multiple cocktails or for making cocktails that will be served in a glass that's too narrow or shallow to cover the Cube, like a Coupe or Martini glass
A Cloche for serving a cocktail enveloped in Smoke
Lighting Your Cube
Light Your Cube
Ignite the cube's surface and cover the cube with your glass of choice.  Once the Hardwood smoke fills the glass, you’re ready to prepare your cocktail. 
Please Note: Safely igniting the hardwood cubes requires a butane torch. A common "cigarette" lighter will not work. 
PLAY

Preparing a craft cocktail is fun and is an exciting way to try new beverages and experiment with flavors.  Use Cube of Smoke to enhance your favorite cocktail or create a new one!  The hardwood smoke that comes from Cube of Smoke can be tailored to your tastes by varying the amount of smoke captured in your glass of choice.  Experiment and have fun and always Drink Responsibly!
Pour, Garnish & Enjoy!
Once your cocktail is prepared, return the glass to the upright position, and add ice if you choose and pour your Cocktail, Garnish and Enjoy!
PLAY

What Comes in each Cube of Smoke Kit?
Each Cube of Smoke Kit comes with four hardwood cubes.  Red Oak, Maple, Hickory and Cherry.  Each cube can be used to make 50 or more cocktails and each Cube of Smoke kit comes with a guide book (Full Color, 52 pages) with step-by-step instructions and cocktail recipes.  The Cube of Smoke Kit is $32 (20% off Retail Price) with Free Shipping in the US.
REWARDS
The Cube of Smoke Kit ~ $32 with Free Shipping in the US!
Cube of Smoke Kit
Hardwood Cocktail Board in Red Oak, Maple, Hickory or Cherry
Hardwood Cocktail Boards in Red Oak, Maple, Hickory or Cherry
 Each Hardwood Cocktail Board is 10" x 5.5" and 1 inch thick.  Each board is cut by hand, laser etched.  The edges are flame burnished and the entire board is finished with a food safe blend of organic wees wax and jojoba oil.  These hardwood boards are durable and perfect for use while preparing your Cocktails and Garnishes.
The laser etched design will be the Cube of Smoke logo, or you can upgrade to a Custom package to allow for your own Logo, Design or Monogram to be laser etched on the board.  See an example of a custom design that was created from a black and white ink drawing.  
Hardwood Cocktail Board in Cherry with a Custom Design :-)
Here's a time lapsed video of a laser cutter etching the Cube of Smoke logo onto a Hardwood Cocktail Board.  :-)
PLAY

Reward Grid
ADD-ONs
For add-on accessories like the Butane Torch & Bamboo Coaster Set, simply add the appropriate amount to your pledge.  After the campaign we will collect your shipping information—you’ll be able to easily apply any extra funds and select the accessories you'd like.   For multiple of the same reward simply multiply your pledge amount on Kickstarter.  We appreciate any extra support!
Time Line
Sep - Oct: Crowdfunding on Kickstarter
Oct - Nov: Collecting surveys, Manufacturing
Nov - Dec: Packaging, sending out rewards by Holiday 2018
Cheers!
To all the Kickstarter backers and creators who keep the spark alive for the creative and passionate people all around the WORLD!  You help us bring our crazy ideas to life and we're continuously humbled by your continued support!
To The Morgan Station, Nicholas Beaudet Photography, Brian Hall Design Group and TWO Chicago for being our creative partners and making us look good! :-) 
To all my friends and family who've guided me and helped me along on this journey.  Thanks!
And to YOU for reading this :-) Thanks!

updates.update_content:
Hello!
Cube of Smoke Backers and Fans! The last 13 days since the last update has been busy and filled with a flurry of activity.  We're glad to say that as of today all the elements needed to fill the Cube of Smoke rewards have arrived!

campaign.story:
I’m Erick Sermon, but if you’re of a certain age you may know me as the Green-eyed Bandit, or as part of the pioneering hiphop duo EPMD, or as the original member of Def Squad crew. You may also know that I wrote or produced the music on many of the hiphop hits of the 80s and 90s, that helped put New York on the rap map.
Now Def Squad is back with a bang, starting with a new album featuring some of the top names of today like Pharrell Williams, Ghost Face, Redman, Styles P, Too Short and Big K.R.I.T. to name a few. 
 New album
The new album is titled “Go” because we want to get maximum exposure from the word go! Besides the artists already mentioned we’re lucky to also have my old collaborators Method Man and Keith Murray on board, along with AZ, Craig Mack, Mr Cheeks, Devin The Dude, Rockwilder, Rico Barrino, and Kid Capri. We're also excited to welcome newcomers Try Bishop, Katelyn and PWise. 
We have 8 tracks in the can so far, and plan to add another 3 so there’ll be 11 in total on the album. I’m a fast worker so it will be ready by the spring, so watch this space…
As a taster, one of the new tracks is called Southern Girl and features Pharrell and Big K.R.I.T. It was inspired by my Mom - who grew up in Alabama and Florida - and I like to think that everyone is a Southern girl at heart.
New Label
The album will be launched on my new independent label - Def Squad Records  - because the music business is very different from how it was back in the 80s and I want to give up-and-coming artists a platform to show what they can do. And at the same time we want to give you, the fans, what you want in the way of music, not what some ivory-towered record company executive thinks you want.
A Brand New Concept… Def Squad Films
To complete the all-round Def Squad music & promo team we’re hooking up with film-maker Shock B - long-time collaborator and the man behind our Shockumentary video above - to launch our very own music video production arm, so we can keep the whole process from idea to finished product in-house.
Why we’re asking for your help
I still have my studio in New York and all the original equipment which enabled me to produce beats like the popular 2001 track “Just Like Music,” sampling the late, great Marvin Gaye. Therefore many of the costs of producing a mainstream album are already covered. But I still need funds to finance the sampling - which doesn’t come cheap - plus a sound engineer and all the costs involved in marketing the album to as wide an audience as possible, not just die-hard hiphop fans but to introduce great music to a new generation.
My proven track record
For the newcomers, here’s a brief overview of our earlier work (14 albums under Erick Sermon, EPMD and Def Squad and music for over 30 movies and documentaries). Tracks like “You Got To Chill”, “Strictly Business” and “Crossover” showcased quality music videos and were some of the genre’s earliest commercial successes.
A Bit of History
I started out with Parish Smith as EPMD (which stands for Erick and Parish Making Dollars). Our first EPMD album, Strictly Business, laid the foundation for modern hiphop, sampling everything from Eric Clapton and Pink Floyd, to Zapp and Steve Miller.
When label deals were shaky and corporate America was still being sold on the commercial viability of rap, Parish & I decided to pursue different paths and I embarked on a career producing music for countless R&B and rap acts. I was one of the early MCs to extend my brand beyond the booth.
In the two decades since, I established myself as a producer, with over 70 million album sales, thanks to working with some of the biggest names in the industry like Akon, Jay-Z, Kanye West, LL Cool J, Redman, Eminem, 50 Cent, Das EFX, Mary J Blige, D’Angelo, Ja Rule, Diddy, Lil Wayne, Mos Def, KRS-One, Craig Mack, Heavy D, Das EFX and many more. For a more comprehensive list of my work see the bottom of the page.
REWARDS
We have 20 incredible rewards that we're excited to share with you, ranging from $2 for a bonus track to $10,000 for a chance to record a beat and music video with me. Here's the full list:
                   ERICK’S SOLO ALBUMS (all went Gold)
Double or Nothing -1995
Erick Onasis - 2000
Music - 2001
React  - 2002
Chilltown New York - 2004
E.S.P. (Erick Sermon’s Perception) - 2015  
ALBUMS FEATURING ERICK AND/OR DEF SQUAD
7 Albums with EMPD from 1988 - 2009 
Def Squad El Nino on the Def Jam Label - 1998 
As himself on 6 albums including Chilltown New York on the Motown label - 2004 
Erick Onasis on the Dreamworks label (set up by David Geffen, Steven Spileberg & Jeffrey Katzenberg) - 2000 
   ERICK AS A MUSIC PRODUCER
Black Eyed Peas - Renegotiations: The Remixes (2006) - Da Bump (Erick Sermon Remix) 
LL Cool J - Phenomenom (1997) - 4, 3, 2, 1 ft. Redman, Method Man, Canibus, DMX 
Ja Rule - Venni Vetti Vecci (1999) E-Dub And Ja ft. Erick Sermon 
Akon - The Longest Yard Soundtrack (2005)  So Fly ft. Blewz 
Busta Rhymes The Big Bang (2006) - Goldmine ft. Raekwon 
Jay-Z Vol.2: Hard Knock Life (1999)  Reservoir Dogs ft. Kid Capri 
50 Cent - Power Of The Dollar (2000) Da Heatwave ft. Noreaga 
FILM CREDITS
Erick has created custom music for many box office hits including:
The Lincoln Lawyer (2011) with Matthew McConaughey  
What Happens in Vegas (2008) with Cameron Diaz & Ashton Kutcher 
Syriana (2005) with George Clooney & Matt Damon
Die Hard: With a Vengeance (1995) with Bruce Willis

updates.update_content: The Vinyl has arrived. All rewards will be shipped out within a week. Thank you for your support
Thank you ALL for supporting this project. Finally...the CD’s have arrived. The Vinyl should be shipped in 2 weeks.

Hello kickstarter supporters, finally the day has come. April 19th, the highly anticipated album Vernia, by Erick Sermon, will be available on all digital platforms. Kickstarter pledges will receive the album 3 days in advance via a zip file. Which will also include the the bonus track as promised. The album release parties will be emailed to those who purchased that reward. We need a list of names in advance for the door entry. All merchandise, Vinyl, CDs and Plaques will be processed and shipped by the end of May.
Album coming in March.....Have a safe and blessed Super Bowl Sunday.
Good morning everyone. I just wanted to wish you ALL a Merry Christmas and hope you have a blessed day.

Good morning Kickstarter Supporters, I am truly grateful for all of your patience and support. This year has been amazing and I am humbled by all of the opportunities that I am afforded. The album is complete but I am waiting for samples to be cleared, which is out of my control. I wish each and every one of you a blessed Happy Thanksgiving. I apologize for the lack of updating but we will be improving that process. Much love. Erick Sermon and the Def Squad TEAM
Thank you ALL for your patience. I’m working hard to deliver the best work and I truly appreciate your support. The album title has changed to “Vernia” in memory of my Grandmother.
We are just waiting on the bandannas to be delivered. We are finishing up on the final touches for the music. All rewards that are ready to go will be mailed within the next 2 weeks. Much love. Peace

Hello everyone. Thank you for your support. Most of the merchandise for the rewards are in. As soon as the last shipment arrives from overseas, we will be shipping everything out. There have been some delays that are out of our control, so thank you for your patience. EPMD is finishing up some shows and I will be doing a live update next week. Def Squad Team

Dear Backers,
Thanks to all of you for supporting this project. I also want to thank my team and all of my family and fans for making this a success. This campaign was all about my fans and creating a movement worldwide. 
Much love and respect to each and every one of you.

campaign.story:
PRESS.
Click on the blue for our recent CinemaJaw podcast, Nerdlocker interview, Broken Frontier article & Nerdophiles interview!
THANK YOU.
We hit our goal! Now it's time for the next level! Film fests and additional rewards. For every $1K, we'll submit to at least 10 film festivals across the country (and world). And we'll keep you informed every step of the way. As for benchmarks:
If we hit $5K, you'll get an exclusive comic screensaver. If we hit $7.5K, you'll get another digital comic story from Zimmerman / Lawrence. If we hit $10K, everyone who backed at $20 or above will get a physical comic along with their other rewards. And digital backers will get another cool screensaver! Now, back to your regularly scheduled campaign...
MONSTER.  
My neighbor and pal, Kian, shot a monster movie with me in our garages and basements. It's called MADE YOU LOOK. And we'd like you to help us finish it.
One of these things is not like the other.
THE ROYAL WE. 
Here's our first set. That's me, writer and director, on screen left. Kian Doughty, star, with the flashlight. Tory Maurer, Director of Photography, with the coolest head tilt in town. And Chris Walas, who needs no introduction but I'll give him one anyway (Academy Award winner of THE FLY, GREMLINS creator), on monster duty.
Don't go in there!
IN THE CAN.
We shot on two separate occasions in two locations using two different 4K cameras over three days. Tory flew in twice to make this happen. Production's wrapped and the initial edit is finished. MADE YOU LOOK... is looking good! 
Look into my eyes.
ALL THE MONIES.
After taxes and fees, 100% of the Kickstarter funds will go to two things and two things alone: post-production and creating rewards. NONE of the Kickstarter money goes to reimburse production costs or personnel. Executive Producer Douglas H. Snyder and partner Bricker-Down Productions (that's me!) are committed to finishing the film with incredible color correction, dialogue editing, sound design and composer partners without taking a dime. Furthermore, pal Kian will be there every step of the way, as we want this to be an incredible learning experience across all film stages for him.
We do have stellar stretch goal rewards in both the physical and digital realms, but any money above and beyond our goal will go to film festival submissions. We'd like the film to go across the globe, and we'll do our best to be there to support it. Especially with Kian and his family!
Seeing triple.
FUTURA.  
Chris told me he was investing in the future when he worked on MADE YOU LOOK. I couldn't have said it better. Let's make a cool little film together - we figure it'll be around 5 minutes - and we'll try our best to get it in a film festival near you. 
Deep background research.
MADE YOU LOOK. 
Production peeps. 
Introducing Kian Doughty!
Basement blues. From the ALEXA negative, no color correction.
Your production team! Justin Zimmerman, Tory Maurer & Douglas H. Snyder. Extra special thanks also to Jason Haskins, Katrina Kerr & Scott Ballard. www.hanfordcreative.com
Would YOU go into a garage with these people?
Chris Walas: www.chriswalascreatures.com
Chris and me with Christina Kortum of Ravenous Studios.
These post-production luminaries are taking reduced fees or simply volunteering their services. Here's who they are, what they'll be doing and why it's important:
Jordan Eusebio will be doing the dialogue edit, sound design and final mix. https://vimeo.com/jordaneusebio 
This is the opposite of what Jordan will be doing on MYL, so I promise he'll look significantly happier in future updates. At least, I hope so!
Kevin Shima is composing the final score. Part of the post budget is hiring lead instrumentalists to make the music as profound as possible. www.kevinshima.com
Jeez, no one's looking super happy in these pics, are they?
Zack Linkow will be doing a vfx pass on the basement portion of the film. For those keeping track at home, the monster sfx is 100% in-camera. We're old school. www.vimeo.com/zacklinkow
There we go. Thanks for the smile, Zack. This is actually on one of our previous projects together.
REWARDS.
The digital bundle represents years of comic work and stories. Here's a sneak preview:
Just a taste of the PDF package.
The exclusive lobby card will be printed on 130 pound paper with a speciality process that increases both contrast and reflection. Shiny and chrome!
Print signed by Justin and Kian. The original art by Russ Brown is available too!
Let's not forget the Picture This tier, thanks to Kian's mom, Jillian @ www.22pagespdx.com
Takes a good picture.
And then we get to Producer, Curator and Logo levels, which come with an original Chris Walas creation. If you back at these levels, get in touch with us immediately so we can reserve your creature! There are seven, and they are first come, first served. So if there's an "X" through 'em, they're already claimed. For higher resolution images of every available critter, please click this bricker-down FB photo album. 
Handsome!
SHIPPING.
Everything will be double packed and sent through either USPS Priority or UPS. This ensures your rewards get to you in a secure, tracked and insured fashion, which will make us sleep better at night. 
With the Doughty family. Are we working hard... or are we hardly working?
THANK YOU.
Seriously, that was a lot to take in. We hope you back the campaign, but regardless... thanks for listening!
Justin & Kian
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Folks, I've delivered multimedia projects on time and on budget for over 15 years. I communicate throughout the process and take my responsibility to my backers 100% seriously. I see no issues with delivering MADE YOU LOOK in a timely and professional manner, especially as production is 100% wrapped and we're well on our way in post. Heck, more than half the rewards are already in hand. Back with confidence!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Photo taken by Kokayi
WHO IS SUBSTANTIAL?
P.G. County Maryland born MC, producer and educator, Substantial, first made his debut in 2000 while working with the late Japanese producer, Nujabes. Since then his soulful and introspective brand of Hip Hop music has received critical acclaim from HipHopDX.com and Ebony.com. His videos have appeared on MTV, VH1 and BET, he has performed around the world and collaborated with artists like Kool Herc, Oddisee and CunninLynguists. He has also worked with major brands such as Ford, Bentley, Amazon and UBER all while remaining a best kept secret.
WHAT?
To This Union A Sun Was Born -2001, produced by late producers Nujabes & DJ Deckstream, is overdue for a repressing and Sacrifice - 2008 (which turns 10 years old in January 2018) has never seen a vinyl release. 
WHY NOW? WHY KICKSTARTER?
This past year, someone has literally asked if I had copies of my first album at every show I've done. Over the last few months, my sophomore LP has also seen a growing amount of requests for a vinyl pressing. Your request have been heard, now it's time to make it happen!
In order to make this happen it requires a lot of money. It's approximately $8,000 (before shipping) just to do 100 black vinyl copies of each release. This campaign will help better gauge how many copies I should press up and if I can afford to do splatter/color vinyl. Luckily, some of the greatest people in the world just so happen to believe in my music, so there's nothing to worry about. ;)
ARE THERE STRETCH GOALS? 
Yes. Two. Details below.
$12,500: If/When we raise this amount, I'll manufacture a new CD version of To This Union A Sun Was Born and cassette versions of both albums and include them in the rewards for those of you who pledge $100 or more. 
$15,000: If/When we raise this amount, I'll do splatter vinyl for To This Union A Sun Was Born and color vinyl for Sacrifice. Everyone who pays $30 or more will receive one of one these two 2LPs. If you pledge $50, you'll get both. Image below.
$15,000 Stretch Goal
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are a few risks and challenges associated with this project. If shipping costs are slightly more than I anticipate, I will cover the difference. Also, my wife and I are expecting our second child and she's due in December around the time I plan to begin fulfilling orders. If there are any delays, you will be contacted. Lastly, in the past it has been a challenging to contact some of my backers because they're contact information wasn't accurate. Please make sure you keep your address and other contact information (including email) up to date.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Introducing Pitch, Please! The game of the sixty second screenplay.
  Great fun for both indoor people and theatrical types alike, Pitch Please takes any game night to the next level: Inside Your Own Mind. 
Unlike many games, this one incentivises you amusing each other. Much, if not all of the gameplay is conversation based. You may be pleasantly surprised by just how fun you and your crew can be.
This improvisational card game puts big budget blockbusters into your hands, with a fully illustrated deck of 53 movie cliches.
 Pitch, Please! Is the creation of cartoonist / comedian Carolyn Main.
How To Play:
The rules are deceptively simple- Each player chooses a studio name, and gets a hand of 5 movie cliche cards. The Producer chooses a genre. Two opposing Pitchers use 3 out of their 5 cards to make a screenplay in that genre. 
Pitchers have one minute to plan, and then one minute to pitch their new movies to the Producer.
  The Producer chooses the winning Pitch of that round. 
That Pitcher now becomes the Producer of the next round. And so on, until they've played through the entire 53 card deck, or somebody has to go do whatever.
Keep your winning pitch cards in a pile through the game. Who's ever stack is biggest, wins! ( Or, is it whoever had the most fun?)
Complete Game Includes: One card deck and box, instructions. 53* movie cliche cards, and one genre card.
*May include additional cards, depending on funding!
Pitch, Please! has been play tested to perfection, with a disparate sample: friends, family, gamers, artists, comedians, writers, normies and strangers alike.  
But don't take our word for it! Here's what real and big deal Pitch, Please! players have to say:
What Are The Money Plans?
First and foremost, we are raising funds to go into mass production.  We'll put in a bulk manufacturing order with local business, Print and Play Games. The bigger the total order, the better the price point we get on our end. So thanks in advance!
All additional monies raised will further production of more content in these directions-  Pitch, Please Podcasts, Live Shows, and internet animations. As well as payment for performers, musicians, technicians, and other future Pitch, Please! contributors.
Here's the Rewards Breakdown:
PLAY

The Bonus Stretch Goals:
At $2,000
Carolyn will host 7 days of Pitch, Please Play! All around Portland,OR during the final week of this campaign. At various local businesses, to be decided. (Business Backers will be given preference, so go ahead and donate at least dollar, and shout out your establishment.)
At $5,000 
Up to five new, bonus cards will be included in every deck! Hey! That's free bonus cards, for everybody! NICE.*
*So long as somebody commissions these new cards on the reward tiers.
At $10,000  
Carolyn commits to recording and releasing at least 10 Pitch Please Podcast Playthroughs, on Itunes and beyond, in conjunction with the River City Podcast Federation,  over the 2017- 2018 year. The podcast will featuring gameplay by comedians, cartoonists, writers, and more! (Probably about a Pg 13- NSFW)
At $20,000 
One new Collectors' Card produced, especially for this launch deck. The particulars of which to be determined by popular suggestions and votes of all backers! To be included in all card orders!
That card will not be available after this kickstarter printing for at least 5 years. And even then, in a different color palette. So this one's special.
*Offer subject to artistic discretion, no sexist racist or homophobic material will be considered.
At $100, 000
If this game should reach the Mega Zone Carolyn officially commits to Pitch, Please! The Sequel! That's right, a whole other 52 card expansion pack, to Kickstart by 2021! 
And should that be successful, there's no shortage of expansion packs in the future. (Based on Sitcoms, Comics, Grindhouse, or almost anything...)
Also! For a whole year, whenever someone sees Carolyn Main and says the title to one of the Pitch, Please! cards, she will give them a deck! Free!* 
*Offer subject to one deck per day. Carolyn's purse is big, but it's allready pretty full of stuff.
At $500,000 
Carolyn will travel across the united states and play Pitch, Please, live, with local talent. At least 5 shows by 2019. 
By 2020 Carolyn will also finish a real screenplay based on ideas already inspired by Pitch, Please! She already has plenty of them.  All backers at the 100$ plus point this campaign go, in the credits! 4 Eva! WOWee!
Look for that movie, in the far future, on the big, medium or small screen. Now that's what I call a ...
Pitch, Please!
It's the big screen in a lil' package.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest risk with all crowdsourced projects is of course the dreaded undeliverable: an idea or product that is simply too expensive or expansive to be created and completed at the volume needed to satisfy the interest.

With Pitch, Please, we've already taken that into account. Our modest funding goal is aimed right where we need it to be, to assure the project a viable and profitable state. 

We've allready worked already with local Print and Play Games to produce demo decks, and are very pleased with both the quality and turnaround of the cards.

To maximise efficiency, all the illustrations have allready been finished. The only wait to the backers will be the manufacturing and shipment of the cards. 

Unless of course, this campaign gets new card commissions, in which case free additional cards go to all the backers! Yay! The new illustrations shouldn't take too long: about an illustration a week, and will be well worth the wait. 

Theres also the risk of being swamped by shipping, but we know of distributors able to help us literally deliver, should the project be fortunate enough to meet great success.

The worst risk of all, would be if the game was just not very good. But we've allready play tested with various groups of gamers, to great success. The news is in- Pitch, Please is a hit!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Not only do You get to commission your own NEW card. You also get 10, count em, 10 Pitch, Please decks, including YOUR card in all 10 decks, to hand out! Wow! You're in a game now, for all posterity.
You also get a 13 X 19 limited edition signed and numbered print of your card. A work of art, you commissioned, ready to frame.
Also, a Pitch, Please! T Shirt! Yeah, heck, why not. We'll make you one of those, too. Neat!
And you get a skype playthrough, with yourself, your party, and game host and creator, Carolyn Main.

support.title: Personal Pitch, Please Play Party!

This is the big time: Carolyn Main will fly to you, with her plus one, and host a Pitch, Please! Playthrough at the location of your choosing! With some cupcakes! Good ones.
Great for patrons of the arts, events, or corperate parties!
This includes 10 Pitch, Please! T shirts! Nice.
Also you get 10 full 53 card decks in the mail!

NIOBE: She is Life and Death Campaign:
Get an oversized special Kickstarter Exclusive edition hardcover collection of NIOBE: SHE IS LIFE with 32 pages of extra material not contained in the retail edition paperback and a Kickstarter Exclusive version of the first issue of the sequel NIOBE: SHE IS DEATH by Jones, Stenberg, May and new artist Sheldon Mitchell. Be the first to read the book well before its in-store release next year.
Written by Sebastian A. Jones (The Untamed, Dusu) & Amandla Stenberg (Everything, Everything, Hunger Games)
Layouts and Concepts by Darrell May (The Untamed, Dusu)
She is Life: Illustrated by Ashley A. Woods (Lady Castle, Millennia War)
She is Death: Illustrated by Sheldon Mitchell (Cable, The Darkness, Vampire Hunter D)
Lettering, Design and Editorial by Joshua Cozine (Witchblade, Superman, Vampire Hunter D)
Cover Artists: Jae Lee, Hyoung Taek Nam, Markus Prime, Rahiem Milton, Matt Waite, James C. Webster, Amandla Stenberg, Ashley A. Woods, Sheldon Mitchell, Michael Person, Olivia Duchess, Mervin Kaunda & Joyceline Furniss.
While first introduced in The Untamed, Niobe's solo story begins years later with the character as a teenager. A child of prophecy is on the road to fulfilling her destiny... Niobe: She is Life.
With a world divided who do you turn to?  
Between two warring nations, in the heart of Western Ujoa, there is a haven to those who have lost their way. Some say you can rebuild your mind and spirit upon the mountains of Ugoma. For a Half-Elven (Sin-Galemren) girl with off-colored eyes, it is a chance to flee a dark past, and rest safely within the secret monatery of her ancestors. But you cannot run from destiny, or hide from the Devil.  
Set within the original fantasy world of Asunda, Niobe: She is Life is a coming of age Beauty and the Beast love story threaded with murder and mystery that leads to all out war.
She is Life Preview Pages
And the upcoming sequel... She is Death.
There is nothing more dangerous and beautiful than a wild woman.
Niobe: She is Death is a tale of hard truths and revelations for a young woman who is tired of running. Niobe has lost her faith – in humanity and the world around her. In the sequel to Niobe: She is Life, we will witness Niobe’s journey from heartbroken teenager to warrior woman, set to take on a world that would see her dead. Narrowly escaping a violent prison death, she learns that girls like her are being abducted. But the hunted becomes the hunter when she allies herself with a savage mentor who teaches her how to take vengeance on those who prey on the helpless – by being a bounty hunter herself. 
Niobe will hunt down and capture human traffickers, rescuing the victims for the families who seek her help. But each step takes her further down the path toward a destiny she did not ask for and a burden she does not want.
She is Death Covers and Preview Pages
And that's only the beginning!
So many to choose from...

Morka Moa is written by Sebastian and Darrell who is also drawing the book. 
THE INNOCENCE PROJECT (CHARITY DONATION)
At Stranger Comics, we like to make the world a better place, and as some other campaigns have done, we are donating a portion of our proceeds to charity. In She is Life, one of the main plot points is a character accused of a crime based on the color of his skin, so we can't think of a better charity to work with than The Innocence Project.
The Innocence Project is a non-profit legal organization that is committed to exonerating wrongly convicted people through the use of DNA testing and to reforming the criminal justice system to prevent future injustice. 
We will donate 10% of our proceeds after the costs of printing and fulfillment with a minimum donation of $1,000 if the campaign is successful. Help us help others and get some great books in the process. And consider donating directly. You can find their site HERE.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are few challenges left that we have not already overcome. The NIOBE: She is Life four issue book is complete as is the NIOBE: She is Death comic #1. (We have also run a successful kickstarter for THE UNTAMED so this is not our first time putting a book together or fulfilling a campaign.) 

Unless there is a delay with the printer or the post office loses packages, there is no foreseen risk of not getting NIOBE if this Kickstarter is successful.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
