updates.update_userinfo: What does Lovecraft Country, Niobe, and Ruining Christmas have in common? PLUS NIOBE and DURA. PLUS PALS!
updates.update_content:
Hey Stranger fam!
Okay, I had to share this right away. It's kind of HBO inspired (which is where we are currently developing Niobe and Asunda) after watching their incredible LOVECRAFT COUNTRY, and knowing our good friend Russell Nohelty has his brilliant Graphic Novel, "Cthulhu is Hard to Spell."
So in case you missed it, Russell, Darrell, and I are writing 8 pages of bonus material to RUINING CHRISTMAS which will take our heroic Christmas Elves, Gimble and Kuz on a very demonic journey with Ichabod Jones. We have created a cover just for it!

updates.update_userinfo: RUINING CHRISTMAS IS LIVE! AND FUNDED IN 3 HOURS! DON'T MISS OUT :)
updates.update_content:
Hey Guys,
Here's a new UPDATE to our RUINING CHRISTMAS campaign! And check your PROMOTIONS FOLDER in gmails to not miss out! Eisner winner John Jennings has graced us with another cover! Check out "SNOWCAT" a beautiful new RED ROGUE cover to go with Iga's! You know we love our Elven heroes!
PLUS 10 Lucky DAY 1 backers will get a FREE REMARK on any cover! So don't miss out!

updates.update_userinfo: EISNER WINNER JOHN JENNINGS + FREE REMARK CHANCE!
updates.update_content:
Happy Holidays!
Please forgive the recent blasts, I have some good news! A) Niobe is returning next year! And with Dura too, maybe with a side of Salem and Vastar just for some villainous dessert.
I like doing stories with ELVES okay ;)
Speaking of RUINING CHRISTMAS:

updates.update_userinfo: HAPPY HOLIDAYS! HOW TO GET A FREE NIOBE COMIC :)
updates.update_content:
Has kinda been taking it. So this Christmas we want to share our comedy caper, which has been in development for a bit. Ya know we like to make comics with Elves! ;)
Hey Stranger fam!
You may see this blasted across the sky of social media and our other kicks, but that's because I am so excited to share this latest franchise with you: RUINING CHRISTMAS! The page is being developed, but the first 48 hours has those crazy sweet early bird deals so don't miss out!

updates.update_userinfo: DECEMBER 1! THE SPIRIT OF GIVING... MARIO KART and more!
updates.update_content:
Hey Guys,
“With a world divided, who do you turn to? If this is the end, who will you be?”
I have mentioned this before. The battle of the duality of the spirit within. This is a theme that permeates the world of Asunda, and especially our two iconic heroes, Stranger and Niobe. The cost can be devastating. And so, with this most important Update I wanted to just say how thankful I am, that you guys have lifted my spirits with the support for our characters but also us as creators in more ways than I can express. We have been waiting for these final add-ons to come in and they did tonight. By the master himself, Jae Lee.

updates.update_userinfo: HOLIDAY SALE! NIOBE: SHE IS DEATH #2!
updates.update_content:
Hi Stranger Family!
Just in case you missed this update We hit another stretch goal on our latest UNTAMED and NIOBE campaign thanks to you guys, now with just 6 Days Left! So thank you so much from the entire team. We love you guys! Cue the awkward Freeze Frame!

campaign.story:
Welcome to the PDX Broadsides' first Kickstarter, for our fourth album, TRUST ISSUES! We want to level-up our music and our band, and with your help and the support of this Kickstarter, we can make that happen! Read on to hear about the band, the album, the rewards — and please spread the word to your friends (#TrustPDXBs)!
UPDATE: We've hit our initial goal and with your help we are MAKING AN ALBUM! Now we're hoping to make lots more, so we have some STRETCH GOALS!
THAT'S IT! NO MORE!
  Read on for details! 
WHO WE ARE
The PDX Broadsides — Hollyanna, Jessica, and Christian — have been playing music together since 2011. Accidentally formed as an a capella pirate shanty group, we soon branched out into our own original compositions. The Broadsides love things, and as a result, many of our songs are about the things we love. Turns out those things are basically nerdy. We have been fortunate enough to be able to operate on only the money we make as a band, thanks to our avid supporters, which is a pretty amazing concept!
The PDX Broadsides
The PDX Broadsides have played all around the West Coast at venues large and small. We’ve done conventions including OryCon (as musical guest of honor), GeekGirlCon, Rose City Comic Con, and GameStorm, or you may have seen us play in shows with The Doubleclicks, Marian Call, or Chamber Band. 
According to Pandora, if you like the PDX Broadsides because of our “comedic sensibility, folk roots, acoustic sonority, and paired vocal harmony”, you probably also like Jonathan Coulton, Ingrid Michaelson, Magnetic Zeroes, Karen Kilgariff, The Finches, Paul and Storm, and Barenaked Ladies. Who’s going to argue with that?
WHAT WE ARE MAKING
THE ALBUM: On our fourth album, the aptly titled TRUST ISSUES, we write about the things that scare us and make us worry, and how we face them with bravery and knowledge... and how sometimes we don’t. 
We’re using this album to challenge ourselves musically, layering our tight trio harmonies in new and unique ways, as well as adding piano and other new exciting instrumentation. 
Professional recording artists the PDX Broadsides
Our songwriting continues to improve as we explore and expand our range of styles, adventuring into new territories: sweet Beatles-esque rock, eerily haunting ballads, and defiant nerd anthems. We are dealing more directly with the themes of self-confidence, social justice, and feminism, expressing these messages through the lens of our nerdy interests.
We plan for "Trust Issues" to have 13 all-ages songs: 
Tiny Little Octopus 
Nerd Love Song 
We Want Rey 
Robot vs Boy 
On The Case 
I Go Both Ways 
Acoustic Kitty 
I’ll Eat You Last 
Noncompliant 
Rocket Science 
The Weather (A Night Vale Song) 
Delta You Delta Me 
Dolores
There's happy stuff, sad stuff, funny stuff, and angry stuff. So much stuff! 
This album will be recorded by Kevin Hahn at Opal Studio, same as our last album, Something Rotten! We are so excited to work with this talented local producer once again!
STRETCH GOALS! 
$5,000 - Commentary Track! - UNLOCKED! The PDX Broadsides record a digital "commentary track" for the album, which will be a free download for backers! Listen to us tell stories about the writing and recording of the tracks on “Trust Issues”!  
$6,000: THE BOOK - UNLOCKED! : We will create and print a BOOK based on our song "The Ultimate Riot!" The book will be illustrated by our very own Hollyanna, and we'll add a copy to all backer rewards at level $75 and over!

$7500 - Missed Connections! - UNLOCKED! - We'll perform dramatic readings of Missed Connections from Portland's Craigslist! Strange and weird fun!

This EP will have three new original songs we kept off of "Trust Issues," plus an alternate version of our song "Rocket Science!" 
$10,000 - "HOLDING OUT FOR A HERO" COVER SONG VIDEO! - UNLOCKED! We'll learn this Footloose soundtrack song and do a video for it, with much frivolity, probably!
$11,000 - NEW KEYBOARD! - UNLOCKED! You'll hear Jessica play keyboard on TRUST ISSUES, and understand why she deserves a quality instrument. We've got our eye on the right one, and you'll be able to hear it on the road if we get to this goal!
$12,000 - FIRST PDX BROADSIDES TOUR! - UNLOCKED!! You can help us do our very first tour, up and down the West Coast - Canada! California! Points on the map!
WHY WE NEED YOU
This is our fourth album! We’ve proven that we can do the job now, and want to better communicate to fans and to a wider audience with the help of Kickstarter! Your pledges will help us hire studio time, enlist the help of visual artists for the CD and merch, and have the time to make this album exactly what we want it to be! 
By pledging to this Kickstarter, you are supporting independent art and helping fulfill our dream of releasing our nerdy, personal music. Thank you!
REWARDS
We love hiring local artists from our talent-filled city of Portland, Oregon, and the rewards for this album reflect that! Check out our top-notch artists: 
The album art & shirt design is by Benjamin Dewey, creator of the incredible Tragedy Series:
Shirt & album cover by Ben Dewey!
The stickers based on our songs are designed by Dane Ault from Monkey Minion Press, Celina Hernandez, and our very own Hollyanna!
Shirts will be printed on soft & sturdy "Next Level" tees in sizes Ladies Small-2XL (size chart) and Unisex Small-3XL (size chart). The design will be revealed soon!
THANKS
Thank you so much for reading this page, for backing if you can and for spreading the word! We're excited to level-up our production, album, and release with the help of supporters old and new! We can't do it without you!
Specific thanks to Quixotic Images for our new promo shots!
Thank you for your support & for sharing! You make us dance with joy!

campaign.story:
4 the BIRDS! is the board game that combines beak-and-taloned strategy and a peck of luck to pit players against one another together in a fun and accessible tabletop game. By constantly balancing the goal of flocking your own birds and blocking opponents' birds, a see-saw battle for avian supremacy ensues.
Fast and easy to learn and play 
Finely balanced mix of luck and strategy 
Territorial disputes between birds vying for the same spot on the board are resolved via a novel "Pecking Order" 
Uses a unique slide mechanic as resolve contested spots
Non-player birds (crows and hawks) add unique chain reaction of board-reorganizing slides and scatters 
Truly an abstract "gateway" game that's great for kids' spatial and numerical skills (and even better for adults who are out of practice) 
Bird pawns are cute, as well as fun to hold and play with! 
You haven't heard bird puns and innuendo until you've heard THESE bird puns and innuendo!  
Gameplay is simple. Each player rolls two dice on their turn, indicating coordinates on the game board grid to place and move six birds on the board. Each turn players have the choice to place a bird at the rolled coordinate or play one of seven Action Cards as they work to achieve the winning formation of a four bird flock in the tree (either a square or straight line on the grid).
On Each Turn:
The current player rolls the dice. 
The player may then choose to either place a bird into the tree (game board grid) OR play an Action Card from his/her active hand. Birds may only be placed in a spot in the tree that contains each number: for example a roll of 7 and 1 has two spots, "17" and "71". 
If all of a player's birds are in the tree, they may choose which bird to relocate at the new coordinate. 
If a double is rolled, a player can take the top action card (last used) from the discard pile and put it back in the active hand. 
If a Hawk is rolled on the brown die, the player must place a Hawk pawn (brown bird) on any "x" on the board (the crossing branch lines between the coordinates) and the player's turn is over. Watch out! Hawks cause all neighboring birds to move off their perch! 
If a Crow is rolled on the black die, the player may place a Crow pawn (black bird) on any spot on the board along the number line indicated by the other die. For example, a 2 allows 12, 22, 32, etcetera, and 21, 22, 23, etcetera. 
If the spot you roll is occupied by another bird, and you do not have Pecking Order, you have to find a different spot. If you do have Pecking Order, your bird can displace the other bird. 
A displaced bird must "slide" along a branch to a new spot, possibly displacing another bird via Pecking Order. 
Once all birds are moved via Pecking Order, the turn ends and play passes to the next player (clockwise).
What is Pecking Order?
Only one bird can occupy any spot in the tree at a time. Each player has Pecking Order over the one (and only one) player to his/her immediate left. Once dice are rolled, a bird can land on an occupied spot if it has immediate hierarchy over the occupying bird via the Pecking Order. If the active bird has Pecking Order precedence and chooses an occupied spot, the displaced bird must relocate (slide) to an adjacent spot (that player’s choosing) along any connecting branch line. If that spot is occupied, the process continues. If there are only 2 players, each player can displace the other. There is no “low” bird or “high” bird as Pecking Order is circular.

PLAY

(1) Quad-fold Game-board
(90) Custom punch-tokens
Tokens combine to make (36) Player Bird Pawns (6 each of Orioles, Cardinals, Budgies, Blue Jays, Finches and Martins)
Tokens combine to make (6) Crow Bird Pawns and (3) Hawk Pawns (Non-Player)
(36) Action Tiles (6 of each color)
(2) 8-sided Dice
(2) 10-sided Dice
GAME BOARD: 18"x18" durable, quad-fold board (folding to 9"x9") of laminated high-density cardboard (edge-bound).
DICE: The game includes four dice. Two 8-sided dice (2d8) - one brown, one black - are used with the inner 7x7 grid when 2-3 players are playing, while two 10-sided dice (2d10) - one brown, one black - are used with the full  9x9 grid when 4-6 players are playing.
BIRDS:  There are eight (8) types of high-density cardboard die-cut pawns, one for each bird species in the game (6 each of six player bird species, 6 crows and 3 hawks).  There are forty-five (45) total pawns included in each set.
ACTION TILES: Each player has a set of six (6) Action Chits in his/her bird's color. All players have the same seven actions available at the start of the game.
The printed art currently depicted is not final. We are taking the functional concepts and working with an amazing artist, Ben Crenshaw, to produce high quality art for the game packaging, printed materials and exclusive autographed prints as rewards!

T-Shirt: $20
Custom Wooden Bird Set - The Originals:  $30
"4 the BIRDS!" competed in Season 1 of Tabletop Deathmatch under the original moniker of "What the Flock?!" and was selected as one of the final 16 out of over 500 other games entered. Watch the full episode below to learn more about the rules, the story behind the game, and what other designers think of it:
Steve Ewoldt has designed numerous tabletop games for personal enjoyment as well as social entanglement at parties, game nights, brewfests, and awkward lulls in conversation anywhere in the world.
Ben Crenshaw joins the team as artist extraordinaire.  Ben is a Washington D.C. native based in Fairlawn, Virginia. His current pursuits include fine art, graphics, game and software design, and publishing.  He has truly raised the bar with the striking new art for the board, the cards and wow, the birds!
John Robinson brings his tech experience to the nest to help hatch the golden eggs of Steve's design and Ben's amazing art. (John, is that a 4 the Birds! app you're working on?! Hmmm…)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've prototyped this game and play-tested for years at game stores, regional gaming conventions (GameStorm, GAMA, GenCon), local pubs, and many gaming events. It's time for a wider release at a higher quality than our current personal budgets allow. We have RE-jiggered this campaign with delivery of a quality game in mind, but first and foremost, delivering the game. We have worked hard to reduce costs and trim waste to get our numbers to a bare-bones level to again, get the game made and into your hands. That's what it's all about! We have selected a parter for producing the game, and we are working with established professionals for shipping and fulfillment. We know what we want and who can make it happen. But, in the event that there are any manufacturing issues, we will address them directly. If you have trouble receiving your copy or have any other problems, you can contact us and count on us for a replacement.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
One of the reward levels that was offered was the custom laser-etched board.  Well, at long last (and a lot more trouble than I EVER anticipated), they are done.  I won't go into details about how this uphill climb kept going up, up, uphill, but in the end, they look phenomenal (better than I EVER anticipated).  Bamboo is where it's at.
More news sooner than later, but anyone waiting on this last bit, watch your doorstep - boards coming soon!

Thanks for the comments (and messages) all of you, and thanks again for helping make the game happen! As I'm sure you all know, this whole game-creation process is a process and an imperfect one at that. This was a monumental task for me to get this thing out there, and yes, hindsight is truly 20/20.  My hope is that this initial print run will end up as a highly sought after item - no one else will ever get a copy of the ORIGINAL-original!  So, small touch-ups ("Cats"?) and slight adjustments (tokens?) are happening as I type. In the end, the copy YOU have is truly special. 4 the Birds is just getting started. It will continue to be polished, primped and preened on it's long world-wide migration, and you all will be front row for any news in that regard. Errata will be compiled and posted soon as well.

Hey all - games are starting to arrive on doorsteps, so keep your eyes peeled!  
And one more time, I will be available tomorrow (Wednesday) at Guardian Games (345 SE Taylor) for a personal hand-off between 6(ish) and 8 pm.  This will be the last chance for in-person evening hand-off  Please message me if you would will be anywhere near Downtown before the end of the week (day or early evening), and we can make an alternate arrangement.  I am Downtown and have the games with me.  If I don't see you this week, I will start the process of sending things in the mail.  (Remember, I wanted to make these available just as soon as I had them, so please take advantage if you can.)

Hi all!  So the distribution is going well!  Most domestic shipping (and the start of international) actually went out by today!  Most of you should see some tracking news shortly and get your copy (copies!) in the mail very soon.  
CALLING ALL LOCALS!!!  I still have a lot of your games that I would love to personally hand you so I'm going to make myself available all (most?) of next week with the remaining copies I have to hand-off during the day in NW Portland.   (That's where my office is.)  So please send me a message and we can coordinate.  I will do one more evening had-off next week as well (probably Wednesday again). I'm trying to make it easy for folks to get it early before the mail.  Please let me know if you would like to pick up in Portland next week.

Hi again!  I am back in Stumptown with a car load of 4 the Birds games!!!  I have handed over about 20 copies to some of the very lucky and very proximate supporters today on my way home.  YOU could be next, so if you're close stop by Guardian Games Wednesday evening 6:30 - 8-ish and we'll check you off the list!  (If you can't make it, we'll do one more personal hand-off, and if we still don't see you, we'll get it into the mail.)
Now, ... don't get discouraged if you're not able to have a Portland address and come down in person.  YOUR games are going into the mail end-of-week.  They will be there soon!

This JUST came through via email:
"Your shipment was just released this afternoon."
So, ... what that means is the game has arrived (the 15th) and been cleared through customs (today)!  I will hear tomorrow when the actual delivery to the fulfillment folks will be made, and I will quickly drive up to Seattle to deliver extras and bring back the Portland deliveries.  Next week should see this game start arriving in peoples' hands.

Hi all - everything appears to be done in China.  It is boxed, wrapped and stacked.  We are awaiting a boat ride officially, and we are hoping - fingers crossed - for a mid-April arrival in Seattle!  You will have your copy SOON thereafter!  (I'll post again when I have a date certain.)
I know a few of you have had some questions as well.  We've been waffling on designs, wallpapers, etc. and ... we just need to stop.  Ha!

campaign.story:
Do you remember stepping on bugs as a child?
Have you ever lit one on fire with a magnifying glass?
What if all those bugs could come back from the dead?
“Don’t Let the Dead Bugs Bite!” is a family-friendly tale about two boys who enjoy killing bugs for fun. They get more than they bargained for, though, when their victims come back from the dead. Will the boys be able to stop the mischievous bugs before it’s too late? Find out in the new children’s book “Don’t Let the Dead Bugs Bite!” Written and illustrated by Stephen Zmina.
A fly that had died in the soup of the week haunted a chef and caused him to shriek.
“Don’t Let the Dead Bugs Bite!” is a picture book for children ages 4-10. The funds that we are raising will be used to pay for the first printing of the book. We plan to make the book available for purchase on Amazon.com, aakp.com, and dontletthedeadbugsbite.com.
Worms that had met with a terrible fate chased after the man that had used them as bait.
With bookstores closing, it has become harder for smaller publishers to get their books into the hands of the consumer. This is why we need your help. We hope you think of this not as a donation, but rather as a pre-purchase of the book.
Sinister spiders were weaving their webs, tying up children asleep in their beds.
We estimate that $8,000 is the minimum amount of money we need to raise for the initial printing. Of course, if we are able to raise more than the initial $8,000 we will use the money for a larger print run, and some marketing, with hopes of the book eventually hitting the shelves of Barnes and Noble, Target and Walmart.
The army was called in to add some relief,but guns were no use, to their disbelief.
Thank you for your support. With your help, we will be able to publish a memorable and thought provoking story for children. After reading it, they may even think twice before stepping on that next bug!
Good night, sleep tight, and "Don't Let the Dead Bugs Bite!"
For more information please visit the following sites:
Don’t Let the Dead Bugs Bite! website: www.dontletthedeadbugsbite.com
All About Kids Publishing website: www.aakp.com
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Dont-Let-the-Dead-Bugs-Bite/144294650147
Twitter: @deadbugsbite, @livingdeadbugs and @allaboutkidspub
Rewards:
We are offering a large variety of rewards for our campaign. Everyone who donates will receive a signed thank you note from the author, and a "Don't Let the Dead Bugs Bite!" bookmark.
We'll also include your name in a "Thank You" list on both www.aakp.com and www.dontletthedeadbugsbite.com. Do you want to let everyone know that you helped us? We will include a link to your web address, facebook, or twitter handle next to your name (must be appropriate for all ages, at our discretion). Want to remain anonymous? That's fine too, just let us know and we will leave you off the list. 

About the author:
Hi, my name is Stephen Zmina, but most people call me Steve.
I grew up in a suburb of Chicago called Wheaton, Illinois. As a child, my friends and I would collect and torture the various bugs that would wander through my back yard. We would squash them, collect them, burn them and so on.
The poor bugs never stood a chance. I really enjoyed destroying them as a child, but as I grew older I started to regret it. I think that's how most people feel. Or maybe not. But what if bugs really do have feelings? What if they could sense that we were about to kill them? Hmmm....
(I'm the one on the coffin)
I've always been a fan of scary movies. My dad took me to see Ghostbusters at the theater when I was 5. When Sigourney Weaver opened up the refrigerator I can remember begging my dad to leave. He spent a couple minutes in the back of the theater aisle convincing me to stay. And I'm glad I did. The enjoyment I found in that movie has stayed with me until this very day. 
(My love for horror movies came at an early age)
As a child, I always enjoyed drawing. My pencil and I became pretty inseparable. I imagined that one day I would work for Disney and spent every day recreating Disney characters.  In 1996 I graduated high school and enrolled in the illustration program at San Jose State University.
It was here that I became one of the “Shrunkenheadman” and in 2001 I received the Society of Illustrator’s Norman Rockwell Museum at Stockbridge award. After graduating from college, part of me still wanted to work for Disney, but the other part of me wanted to create stories all my own.
I came up with the idea for "Don’t Let the Dead Bugs Bite" in 2004. I was playing around with the idea of a group of ‘superhero’ bugs and needed an adversary for them. The idea was originally for the superhero bugs to face off against a bad group of bugs that had died and come back from the dead. This quickly morphed into an origin story of how the bugs died and wanted revenge on the children that had squashed them. And with that, "Don’t Let the Dead Bugs Bite!" was born.
I recalled my childhood and my love of scary movies and decided I wanted to write a scary, but not too scary, book for children. Dr. Seuss was also a large influence of mine. I have always admired his writing style and wanted to emulate that style in my own writing.
I have high hopes for "Don't Let the Dead Bugs Bite!"  I think this children's book is just the beginning. I have also written a full length screenplay and one day... one day I hope to sit back in and watch "Don't Let the Dead Bugs Bite!" on the big screen.
I can't wait for everyone to read "Don't Let the Dead Bugs Bite!" I'm very happy with the way it turned out and I'm sure your family will enjoy it.
About the Publisher:
All About Kids Publishing is an independent children’s book publisher based in the San Francisco Bay Area. We strive to set the standard in children’s picture and chapter book publishing by creating innovative books of the highest quality, with beautiful artwork for children of all ages. AAKP’s dedicated staff breathes life into our titles by pairing selected manuscripts with artists of exceptional talent and creativity. Our books will open new doors to imagination with timeless delight and universal appeal. We hope you will find, within our books, all the love, warmth, and joy with which they have been prepared; and that you will cherish them for years to come.

campaign.story:
Captain Anna Arrives - From issue 0.
DARK ANNA AND THE PIRATES OF KADATH is a creator-owned comic book series that brings together swashbuckling pirate adventure with the dark mythology of Cthulhu. Written by Aaron Duran and illustrated by Ethan Slayton, DARK ANNA is the tale of a fierce pirate captain who uses the blade, the gun, and the spell to brave a distant, nightmare world - all to have her revenge against those who wronged her.
Never bring a knife to negotiations - From issue 0.
DARK ANNA AND THE PIRATES OF KADATH follows Captain Anna as she's driven from her native lands to a place far more sinister and alien. Charting a course down waters human eyes were never meant to see, Captain Anna will master arcane secrets and spellcraft as she leads her crew to their day of reckoning. This fearsome pirate vessel and her crew will have their just reward, or lose their lives - and their immortal souls - trying.
Terms not accepted - From issue 0.
Inspired by the real-life saga of Captain Christiana Anna Skytte, a 17th century Swedish royal who would go on to commandeer her own pirate vessel before vanishing on the Baltic Sea, DARK ANNA AND THE PIRATES OF KADATH is a high fantasy exploration of why this master marauder was lost to the history books. Fans of Conan the Barbarian, The Wake, or Northlanders should not miss out on this epic tale that crosses the high seas and sails deep into the realm of Lovecraftian nightmares.
Why Dark Anna?
Because the story of Christina Anna Skytte is one that needs to be told. For too long has this intriguing woman been lost to the pages of history. There is no better way to bring her back into the light than by casting her into a sea of horrors and adventure within HP Lovecraft's little-used Dreamlands setting. It doesn't matter if you're a fan of high seas adventure, deadly monsters, or dark magics - DARK ANNA AND THE PIRATES OF KADATH is the comic for you. Captain Anna is sailing soon. Will you join her crew and sail under the blood red flag?
Who else can negotiate? - From issue 0.
How Can You Join the Crew?
You can back DARK ANNA AND THE PIRATES OF KADATH at any level that feels comfortable and feasible. You can also help spread the word of this project to your friends, family, or anyone that loves pirates, sea monsters, and action in a slightly darker setting. We're asking just enough to compensate the people that help make this book a reality. As well as production and shipping costs once the project is funded. If we raise more than our target goal, well, that would surpass our wildest dreams. And to that end, we have special stretch goals in place for those dreams. Kickstarter really has ushered in a new and fantastic era in comics. Please help us in continuing this bold new era of publishing and as Captain Anna says... NO QUARTER!*
*That's some old time pirate speak for not showing a lick of mercy. Ever. Just think of all the awesome pirate phrases you'll learn if you back DARK ANNA AND THE PIRATES OF KADATH!
Here there be monsters! From issue 1.
You can learn more at the DARK ANNA AND THE PIRATES OF KADATH Facebook page.
Aaron Duran has written many successful and critically acclaimed creator-owned comics, including the ComiXology Submit Top-100 series La Brujeria, and the best selling short Frankenstein on Mars for Red Stylo Media.  In addition to his comic work, Aaron has just completed his first novel and is a regular contributor to Newsarama. You can learn more about his work at www.geekinthecitycomics.com
Ethan Slayton is a graduate of the Joe Kubert Art School and has had his work featured in many RPG books for AEG. In addition to his game work, Ethan has inked pages for B.Clay Moore's "Battle Hymn" for Image Comics. Other samples can be found at his personal art page.
1st Stretch Goal

campaign.story:
UPDATE: 5 December 2014

"IT'S THE FINAL COUNTDOWN" MUSIC SPECIAL!

Stretch Goal #1 NOW $44,000!
We are just short of the 10% we need to recoup the bulk of our Kickstarter and Amazon payment processing fees and would really like to get the DIGITAL SOUNDTRACK to Backers. SO, if we cross $44,000 we have decided to release the Hashtag Soundtrack to our $30 and above Backers!
Help us get there and get some amazing tunes by composer Joe Terrana! (see the bottom of this page for full details!)
____________________________________________________________________
UPDATE: 3 December 2014

Stretch Goal #1: $48,000
What you get: If we achieve this stretch goal, everyone who pledges at the $30 or more level will receive the Hashtag Digital Soundtrack!

What we’ll do: Any funds we receive towards this stretch goal will help us to recover our fundraising expenses and will allow us to put those funds toward the film. (see the bottom of this page for full details!)

Stretch Goal #2: $60,000
What you get: If we achieve this stretch goal, everyone who pledges at the $60 or more level will receive a very limited gold foil stamped Signature Collectors Card. This special edition card will feature a never-before-seen image of Gigi as X, emblazoned with Gigi's golden signature.

What we’ll do: Any funds we receive towards this stretch goal will be put toward key areas to improve the film. These include a larger/better equipped stage, a larger and more detailed set, quicker post-production and more.(see the bottom of this page for full details!)

____________________________________________________________________

hashtag n. (on social media web sites and applications) a word or phrase preceded by a hash and used to identify messages relating to a specific topic; (also) the hash symbol itself, when used in this way.

On August 25, 2007, a new word was born into our collective awareness. The “hashtag” was invented to manage the growing torrents of social media information into conversations that would span the globe. Usage grew, social media exploded, and a new form of notoriety was created—the social media superstar. Connected, adored, instantly validated, what’s next for a celebrity when culture is nothing but clicks?

ABOUT THE FILM
Hashtag is a science fiction short — a sleek, smart, and sexy view of a world where social media dominates every moment of our lives. Hashtag follows “X”, the ultimate social media maven, a charismatic woman attracting the attention of tens of millions of online followers. "X" has attained everything she's ever wanted. She's #famous, she's #watched, and one unpopular move could mean the #end.

Hashtag is directed and co-written by Ben Alpi (Cowboy Creed, Silver Lining) who was inspired by a TED talk to write a story about our culture’s obsession with speed. Ben approached veteran sci-fi writer, Kevin Rubio (Star Wars: The Clone Wars, Ben 10, Green Lantern: The Animated Series, TROOPS), to co-write the script and the present incarnation of the script was born. Hashtag is an original, imaginative and thought-provoking tale in the wicked tradition of The Twilight Zone. Through the medium of classic science fiction storytelling, our writers weave a disturbing story of our all-too-possible future as a social-media society obsessed with virtual information and celebrity.
Starring as “X” is Gigi Edgley. A superior and nuanced actress, Gigi is well known for her role as “Chiana” in Syfy Channel’s internationally acclaimed sci-fi series Farscape, and more recently as the host of Jim Henson’s Creature Shop Challenge. She has also had a leading role in the Australian series, Rescue Special Ops and appeared in USA network TV miniseries, The Starter Wife. Well-versed in alternate realities, Gigi is skilled at creating amazing connections between our present selves and the “other” of speculative fiction.
Gigi Edgley will be 'X' in Hashtag
A RETURN TO KICKSTARTER
Cowboy Creed, also written and directed by Ben Alpi, was successfully produced thanks to the support of generous Kickstarter Backers. Cowboy Creed (http://runicfilms.com/watch-cowboy-creed) did the film festival circuit and garnered two award nominations. Kickstarter Backers helped to create a completely independent, high-quality film, and now we need your help to bring an even more ambitious and timely film to the screen.

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP
Science fiction is perhaps the priciest genre to put to screen because—from sets to costumes and props—everything has to be created to showcase a world that has yet to come. And that’s in addition to the normal production insurance, stage and equipment rental, and crew costs. After the camera rolls, post-production services and detailed visual effects require additional funds to create a compelling and believable vision of the future.

The goal above is the minimum that meets our production needs.  Any additional funding above that level will help us make the film that much better!

That’s why we want to bring you in as part of our team and help us to bring this beautiful and darkly textured film to light.  Please join us in this great endeavor and help us add to a long tradition of speculative fiction that explores the ever-evolving human condition.

Also, like our last Kickstarter, you’ll get some really great rewards! Depending on your backer level, you can receive a copy of the finished film, the official poster, signed photos of the cast, an invitation to join us on the set of the filming and much more! Also, look for our Cowboy Creed Legacy Pack where you can score some great Western goodies.
MEET THE TEAM
We have pulled together an amazing team of artists to make Hashtag a reality.  Producing the film will be Jyotika Virmani, Executive Producer of Cowboy Creed, along with Robert Alpi (Cowboy Creed) and Gigi Edgley (One Step Ahead, Nobody Knows). We will be working again with other Cowboy Creed alumni: Director of Photography, David Berry (Judas Kiss, Star Trek New Voyages: Phase II); Production Designer, Meg Savage (The Skeptic); Composer, Joe Terrana (Cuban Sandwich Crisis, The Gita, Magadog); Film Editor, Jeff Handy; Line Producer, Erik Goodrich (Beyond Scared Straight, Star Trek New Voyages: Phase II); and Sound Editor, Ralph Miller (Star Trek: Renegades, Judas Kiss). Joining this team is our visual effects supervisor, Deke Kincaid (The Chronicles of Riddick, The Water Horse, Pirates of the Caribbean series, National Treasure: Book of Secrets, Deja Vu).

We have the team. We have the knowhow. But in order to turn our concepts into reality, we need you to be a part of the team, too.

KICKSTARTER FINANCE BASICS
To back the film, all you need is a credit card. Pledges are logged by Kickstarter and no money is charged unless we meet or exceed our goal. Kickstarter calls this all-or-nothing funding.  Once our Kickstarter is complete, each donor’s credit card will be charged securely through Amazon Payments provided by Amazon.com

UPDATES
Don't forget to check out our Updates page to watch videos from Kevin Rubio (co-writer), Jeff Handy (editor), Meg Savage (production designer), and Joe Terrana (composer) on why they think this is a project worthy of your support!

A BACKERS EXCLUSIVE REWARDS ADDITION!
Our Backers have sent us a phenomenal number of messages of support! As a THANK YOU we will send ALL our Backers at the $30 and above level a set of Hashtag #MeetX Collectors Cards! You won’t get these pieces of beautiful art anywhere else!
Hashtag #MeetX Collectors Cards
STRETCH GOALS DETAILS!
Because we have had such enthusiastic support from our Backers, we would like to introduce some Stretch Goals! First, we have many first time Kickstarter Backers so here’s a quick definition:

A stretch goal is a target for funding beyond the original Kickstarter goal. Meaning, our original goal is $40,000 but if we exceed that, this is what we’ll do with any additional funds. As extra ‘thank you’s’ we’ll also be adding new rewards. Of course, the funds will be collected whether stretch goals are met or not, as long we meet our Kickstarter goal.

So, since we have achieved our original Kickstarter goal of $40,000, our stretch goals are:
Stretch Goal #1: NOW $44,000! (was $48,000)
What you get: If we achieve this stretch goal, everyone who pledges at the $30 or more level will receive the digital soundtrack for Hashtag!
What we’ll do: Any funds we receive towards this stretch goal will help us to recover our fundraising expenses and will allow us to put those funds toward the film.
As we said, our Kickstarter goal is the bare minimum we need to produce this film. Out of the total funds you pledge, only 80% will go toward making the film. The reason for this is because 10% of the total goes towards Kickstarter and credit card transaction fees. We have budgeted another 10% for fulfilling rewards. So this leaves about 80% or $32,000 to put toward the actual making of the film - a film that will involve a cast and crew of about 35 people, equipment rental, set and costume design and creation, original music composition and recording, visual and other effects, as well as production insurance.

Stretch Goal #2: $60,000
What you get: If we achieve this stretch goal, everyone who pledges at the $60 or more level will receive a very limited gold foil stamped Signature Collectors Card. This special edition card will feature a never-before-seen image of Gigi as X, emblazoned with Gigi's golden signature.

What we’ll do: Any funds we receive towards this stretch goal will be put toward key areas to improve the film. These include the rental of a larger/better equipped stage, the creation of a larger and more detailed set, and a more flexible shooting schedule. This will also allow us to hire more visual effects artists which means we finish the film faster and get it into your hands sooner!


Thank you kindly for your #Support!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
In addition to the expense of producing science fiction, there are additional risks and challenges when making a film, such as scheduling delays, equipment trouble, and other unforeseen costs. Our team of professionals has had experience in a range of filming environments, and especially science fiction. They know how to handle these set-backs and still continue, with creativity and ingenuity, to produce high-quality work.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Hi there! We're the Doubleclicks. Thanks to this Kickstarter, we are going to make a lot of awesome things this year! Backers will be able to follow along on our progress on the CD, videos & more via updates! You can also check us out at http://thedoubleclicks.com and watch our videos on our YouTube channel! To be kept up to date on songs, the album, and our live shows around the country, subscribe to our e-mail list! 
Thank you for unlocking all these stretch goals!
Future stretch goals:
There are more details about all of these goals below!
Hi, we’re the Doubleclicks, and we write songs about things like dinosaurs, Dungeons & Dragons, love, books, and cats. We also have a cello, and we’re sisters. You may know us from performing at conventions around the country, from many songs and collaborations (including the theme song for Cards Against Humanity), or from our big geek girl pride music video that came out last year, "Nothing to Prove," full of amazing geek girls and some of our nerdy friends.
We want to make a new album this year called “Dimetrodon”, featuring songs we've written over the past year, with studio-quality production and full-band arrangements. We also want to bring back our “Weekly Song Wednesday” music video project this summer. And to do these things, we need help!
We've got some rewards, many of which are exclusive to backers of this Kickstarter! We have t-shirts, dice, copies of the new CD, tote bags, custom songs (and mini meowing-themed-ringtone-songs), and even the opportunity to be immortalized in an art poster that is included with every CD! But even if you can only donate a little, you'll be contributing to our ability to make more and greater things, and we appreciate it!! 
The more money we get, the more exciting things we can produce this year.  We have plenty of ideas on how to turn money in to FUN(ny). Funny? Yes. So take a look at the project, and please share it with your friends—we can't do it without you! We are extremely thankful that you let us make music for you, and we want to do it forever. FOREVER. 
 The Dimetrodon Album
Dimetrodon will be our 3rd full-length album and the second with a "full band studio sound." We want to do this one bigger and better than any album we've done before. We'll be working with pros on the arrangement, mixing and production, including musician, comedian, producer and awesome human being Mike Phirman.
Most of the songs on the Dimetrodon album will be our favorite compositions from 2013's Weekly Song Wednesday project, cleaned up, re-organized and arranged for a full-band sound. There will also be a couple brand-new songs on the album as well as some revivals from the Doubleclicks archives. 

Weekly Song Wednesday (unlocked!)
This is how WSW (Weekly Song Wednesday) works: we write a song, we film a video for that song, and we release these videos once a week on Wednesdays for some number of weeks. WSW is a songwriting exercise, a YouTube project, and a really, really fun way for us to make music and share it. Unfortunately, by itself WSW really doesn't break even, and without crowdfunding we just can't put the time and resources into the project to make songs and videos of the quality that we imagine in our brains. This year, we did Weekly Song Wednesday for 14 weeks, from September through December, and it was really fun. Dimetrodon was one of our favorite songs and videos from that project, check it out:
 
If we meet our initial Kickstarter goal, then, in addition to producing the album Dimetrodon, we will launch a new Weekly Song Wednesday project this spring/summer with new songs and videos that we can spend much, much more time on than we could last year. These videos could include good cameras, other people to hold the cameras (crazy, right?), props, costumes, and much more time spent on rehearsal, editing and doing lots of takes. Thanks to your generous backing, Weekly Song Wednesday will now be 10 weeks long instead of our original 5-week goal!
-
 Monthly Song Monday (unlocked!)
We can't do Weekly Song Wednesday all year long: we need to tour, and sleep sometimes, and take breaks to recharge our songwriting muscles. However, we do want to keep releasing things, so at the $35,000 stretch goal, we will unlock a Monthly Song Monday project where we release a new song and video every month (on a monday). This will happen for 12 months, but we will pause this project during the months during which Weekly Song Wednesday is happening and re-start afterwards—so this project will last for longer than a year.
  Monthly Live-Streamed Internet Show (unlocked!)
In Portland, we produce a show called #NerdNightOut in which we fly in our favorite performers from around the country and do an awesome variety show. It happens every few months, but only locally. We'd love to put on a show with our friends and favorite performers everywhere in the world, but we can't. Or can we? If we unlock the $42,000 stretch goal, we will do a monthly live-streamed show (from March 2014 to December 2014). It will be part concert, part chat and part Q&A. We'll also invite our friends to be guests sometimes, so you can hear other people's songs and stories! It will be an Internet-wide Nerd Night "In"! (We're still working on that title). 
-
More awesome stretch goals UNLOCKED
The Doubleclicks coloring and activity book: UNLOCKED
If we reach this $55,000 stretch goal, we’ll make a short Doubleclicks-themed coloring book with help from talented artists! It’ll be a free PDF download for all backers who have selected a reward at level $12 and above, and will feature art by Molly Lewis (singer/songwriter/doodle genius), Ash Vickers (MegaCynics), John Kovalic (of Munchkin, Dork Tower & much more) and Lar DeSouza. There will also be activities included a Mad Lib by author John Scalzi! Here's a sample set of pages by the amazing Molly Lewis:


Animated music video: UNLOCKED!
Our very first video was an animated one, created by the amazing Brad Jonas for our Dungeons & Dragons song. Since then we have wanted to create more, but we just haven't had the resources... until now? At $65,000 one of our videos for Monthly Song Monday videos will be ANIMATED, and it will likely be ADORABLE. Our animator is OnlyLeigh, animator, artist and creator of the excellent webseries FanGirls. Her showreel gives a good idea of how fantastic the video will be: 


Kid's EP: UNLOCKED!
At $75,000, we will write and record a 5-song kids EP (for grown-ups, too) including songs about: science, history, and strong female characters, to be released in 2015. 

There are many many people in the world more qualified to talk about gender issues than we are, but here’s what I know: when I was a kid, in school and church and books, most to all of the heroes I saw were men. Media taught us that boys went off and had adventures and became doctors and scientists, and girls should find themselves a cool man who was a doctor or a scientist, and attract him by wearing uncomfortable dresses and losing weight. We want to make songs that tell a different story. Our goal with the songs on the new EP will be to teach you about things and people you don’t usually learn about. People like Grace Hopper: a computer scientist who basically invented the compiler and, according to legend, discovered the first computer bug (it was an actual bug.) Grace & other awesome people will be featured on this EP, if it's funded. 
Stretch Goal Freeeeeebiiiird!: UNLOCKED!
We can think of no better way to show our appreciation than to succumb to popular demand at the risk of our own sanity: we will cover Lynyrd Skynyrd's "Freebird" and make a video for you, and we will make it fun for ourselves and you. A download of our cover will be available in the 2014 song vault. 

Current Stretch Goal: $80,000 - UNLOCKED!
Thank you all for backing us like crazy!! Even now, your donations are going to help us level-up our music and videos all year. For a final bit of appreciation, we're gonna make you buttons! If we are mailing you anything: a CD, dice, or anything bigger, we will also send you a cool SHINY BUTTON with art by SOMEONE GREAT to show that you are an awesome Kickstarter backer.
The Dimetrodon CD physical package is very exciting for us: we are hiring amazing artist Kris Straub (who makes Broodhollow and Chainsawsuit), of whom we are huge fans, to make the album cover. Here's what his art style looks like:
-
The cover art for the Dimetrodon album will be made by Kris Straub!
The physical CD will also include a pull-out mini-poster created by Lar DeSouza, artist of the webcomics Least I Could Do and Looking for Group. If you back at the "Immortalization" level, a caricature of you (based on one reference photo you provide) will appear in this poster with us!

We are creating three new Doubleclicks custom six-sided dice for this Kickstarter featuring images inspired by this album: a Dimetrodon, a cat, and an image of us, the Doubleclicks! These are designed by the amazing Brian Tatosky!


The 2014 Song Vault is a website where all the songs we write for weekly song wednesday and some other songwriting projects in 2014 will be available for download to backers who unlock it (at the Dimetrodon level and above). You may also find some demos, rarities, and other little ditties we think you'll find fun in this vault. 

T-Shirts and tote bags will feature a Doubleclicks design which is ONLY available through this Kickstarter! The art will be created by webcomic artist Abby Howard of Junior Scientist Power Hour and The Last Halloween! 
T-shirts will be available in adult sizes from S-3XL in a Gildan Unisex Ultra Cotton Tee (sizing) and S-2XL in a "Ladies" Bella Favorite Tee (sizing). Totes will be these jumbo eco-conscious numbers (take a look!). If you select the T-shirt and Tote level or add a T-shirt or tote onto another level for $35 additional, you will be able to choose any size of t-shirt, OR a tote instead, in a survey that we send out after this Kickstarter is over.

  NEW: Dimetrodon Plush!
It's a little baby Dimetrodon plush!!!! This new, special, very exclusive, very cute plush was designed for this Kickstarter and will be individually made just for you by crafting genius Tally Heilke. The fleece Dimetrodon is approx. 17 inches long and soft and friendly. It may or may not eat sharks.
Dimetrodon and “Rawr, Velociraptor” KNITTED HATS! A local here in Portland, Cathy of Frivolite Handcrafts, has created a knitting design for “toque”-style hats with Dimetrodons and Velociraptors on them, and she will be making a set of them for this Kickstarter! You will be able to select size and style. 
Doubleclicks Dice Bags!
There are two different kinds of Doubleclicks dice bags! The first are made by Katrina Keller, made in your choice of Dimetrodon or Velociraptor, with or without “The Doubleclicks” text. Yes, those are all adorable little pieces of fabric, painstakingly cut out and assembled.
The second kind of dice bags are gamer-tested, gamer-designed, gamer-approved flat-bottom bag from GeekyLyndsay of Dragon Chow Dice Bags. The one you order will have a Doubleclicks design, but the photos below show you what Dragon Chow bags look like.

For "Kitty Ditty Ringtone" and "A Song For You" awards: We are excited to write you a song, but we've got some rules. Subject matter can't be pornographic, illegal or offensive (to us.) We will have final subject-matter approval, but we will do our best to make sure you're happy with it, too. We retain rights to the songs and performances, but you can use them in whatever non-commercial context you'd like. If you have something very specific in mind, feel free to e-mail or tweet us before backing so we know for sure that we can give you what you're looking for.

Circuit Bent Cat Keyboard: This reward is a custom-modified toy cat-shaped keyboard. It will be messed up just for you by our friend (musician, computer geek and electronics-tinkerer) using circuit bending. As a result, it will have a 1/4" audio jack to be plugged in for recording and performance, and, when put into "freak out" mode, will make cool distortion-y noises to your command. You can read more in our Kickstarter Update about the keyboards. 

Game Night: If you back at this level, you'll get one spot at the gaming table with us for a 4-hour session of D&D! We'll do what works best for you: either a Google Hangout or an in-person game night in Portland. The game will be DM'd by our friend Justin Turner of gaming podcast GoingLast.net. 

Helpful Chart for "who gets what" in rewards:
Add-Ons
Do you want some extra merch that's not included in a specific reward level? If you back at $25 or above, you can add on an item from the list below. Add on the appropriate amount to your pledge, and once the Kickstarter is over we'll get in touch to talk about what you want. 
- Kickstarter-exclusive t-shirt or tote bag: $35 / $45 int'l
- Dimetrodon CD: $15 / $20 int'l
- Set of 3 new custom Doubleclicks Dice: $10 / $13 int'l
Digital Add-On:
- Digital Doubleclicks Back Catalog $35
includes Lasers & Feelings (2013), Chainmail & Cello (2012), Beta Testing 1-2-3 (demo CD, 2010) and Christmas Ain't About Me EP (2012)
- Plush Dimetrodons: if you want a Dimetrodon plush and have already selected another limited reward, which you *also* want to keep, here's the deal: if there are still plushes left after the Kickstarter is over, we will make them available as limited add-ons on a first fill-out-your-survey, first served basis. More information about that will be available when the Kickstarter ends.
If you want copies of our old CDs, old t-shirts or last year's dice set (with velociraptor, cello and guitar dice designs), you can buy those at our regular, non-Kickstarter merch store.


How the money is spent

Thanks are due
Thank you to to Paul (of Paul and Storm), Storm (of Paul and Storm) and Joseph Scrimshaw for the immense wonderful amount of advice that has made this Kickstarter rock. Thank you to Brian Tatosky for designing things for us and being the nicest person. And thank you to everyone else who is making things, backing and generally putting up with some very excited and very stressed out Doubleclicks. 
The "lock" and "unlock" icons are by AnsteyDesign from the Noun Project, used under a Creative Commons – Attribution (CC BY 3.0) license.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We feel confident in our ability to complete this project in our estimated timeline, but things like manufacturing delays, delays in completion of various moving parts, and health, weather, and raptor attacks could cause delays. Fortunately, the songs for the album are already on their way to album-ready, we have been thorough in researching every step of the manufacturing process, and we've done all of these things before without failing or running away: managing pre-orders for previous albums; weekly song songwriting challenges; album recording and production; international shipping. Thank you for donating and making the Doubleclicks possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey team—
You were all very nice about it when we told you last year that we were sorry we hadn't gotten to our "Strong Female Role Models Kids EP" stretch goal from this Kickstarter yet. But here's an update.... we're working on it. Or, something like it. 
We have been doing research and some writing, and also developing a project that will be doing a very similar thing but in a much better way, involving experts and a lot of learning. That project is called "YOU SHOULD WRITE A SONG ABOUT THAT" and it just launched today.

updates.update_userinfo: 2015 Kid's EP of science, history and strong female characters: where is it?
updates.update_content:
***We have just placed our order for the first re-printing of Dimetrodon!!!***
We ordered a lot of these CDs, more than of any previous CD we've made, and there were boxes and boxes and boxes of them in our house... and then Aubrey did inventory today and realized we had *14* remaining. We want to thank you so so so so much for making this happen. You are all amazing, thank you for supporting this project. You helped us create a thing that took us around the country, and then  a bunch of STRANGERS who didn't back this Kickstarter still wanted to buy this thing you invested in! There were many many many of them than there are of you (not even counting digital sales, which are crazybonkers as well), meaning you created a multiplier effect of sharing our music with your investment. Does that make sense? That is extremely exciting to us.

It's been exactly one year since this Kickstarter funded, friends! It feels like ages. Thank you so much. Aubrey quit her job about a year ago now, and since then the Doubleclicks has evolved like crazy into a wonderful multi-faceted full-time endeavor.

Hey friends!
We're still getting some messages from people saying "Hey, did that album ever come out? Why didn't you send it to me?"
OH NOES!
It looks like a VAST majority of you have already downloaded your digital copy of the album, and I imagine some of you haven't done so because you got a physical CD. But : it's not because we didn't send it, it's just because of an incompatibility between our e-mail system and yours, and we can easily remedy the situation. (that way no e-mail systems are involved)... and we will get you your code immediately!

updates.update_userinfo: End of 2014, end of this project, plus some meows and a video

campaign.story:
We Won "Project of the Week"!!!
We just won Indiewire's "Project of the Week" Contest!!
Velta Buka, the star of Hybrid Vigor, has a short message for you. Please take a second and watch it.
This is a mock-up of what our poster will look like. Everyone that backs us can get their photo on it. Even for just $1!
The Story
Hybrid Vigor is a feature film about life, death, violence, morality, immortality, love, and loss in the USSR during Soviet times and in present day Latvia. It opens on frozen Lake Baikal in Siberia during Soviet times. Most of the film takes place in present day Latvia. More details about the plot will be revealed in the coming months. 
Production Status
We have already begun shooting. The photos you see on this page are from scenes we have shot. Hybrid Vigor is not being made like a normal film with a fixed shooting schedule and clear phases of production. We decided to use a more organic method of filmmaking. We may be editing scenes we recently shot while in pre-production for scenes we will soon shoot. Maybe we will shoot 2 days, edit 2 days, shoot 2 days and then take a break for a week or two so we can edit and prep the next scenes we will shoot. 
We are organized and have a clear plan, but everything will be done in a very flexible way with a small dedicated crew and eager cast. This is how we are going to make this little film look as good as anything you will see in your local cinema and for less than the price of the catering budget on a "normal" film.
Hybrid Vigor is being made on location in Eastern Europe. One scene was shot in Estonia on a frozen lake on the Russian border. Most of the rest of the film is being made in and around Riga, Latvia.
Prior to moving to Latvia I was living in Los Angeles and I didn't really like the direction my life was going. I had never left the US and wanted to get out and explore the world so I took a 10 day trip to Europe. One of the places I visited was Latvia. Immediately I decided I must make a film here one day. 
After I returned home from my trip, literally as I stood in front of my door with my suitcase, I stopped and said to myself, "What am I doing here? I'm moving to Latvia." I immediately booked a flight and sold my car. A week later I was living in Latvia. I had absolutely no plan, but I had a very clear goal.
Latvia is a small country with a population of just over 2 million people. It borders Russia to the East and was once part of the Soviet Union. Latvia broke free from Soviet rule on August 21st, 1991 and has been an independent nation state ever since.
Hybrid Vigor stars Velta Buka (top) in her feature film debut and co-stars Jevgenija Mirosnicenko (left) and Aleksandr Ivanov (right). All three actors are native to Latvia. No other parts have been officially cast yet.
Current Cast
Velta Buka
Jevgenija Mirosnicenko
Aleksandr Ivanov
We will have more casting news soon.
My Story
My name is Brandon. My first film was a low budget independent film I wrote when I was 18 years-old and directed when I was 20. The film co-starred Dee Wallace (The Howling, ET), Dennis Haskins ("Mr. Belding" in Saved by the Bell) and Joyce DeWitt ("Janet" in Three's Company). It was professionally done with a large crew of around 30 people and shot on 35mm film with Panavision cameras. Unfortunately the film negative and sound was stolen and the film has never been completed. I was able to recover the film negative, but was never able to get the sound. After nearly a decade of effort I had to accept that it was over.
Moving On
A few years ago I Executive Produced the critically acclaimed arthouse film Loren Cass. Variety called it, "A starkly radical film debut of uncommon power and artistic principle." The New York Times said it was, "Remarkable... One of the year's great discoveries." The film was solely the director's vision. I was just there to help support the talent I saw in him.
It's Time
I learned a lot working on my first film and even more in the years since. I got my start as a writer/director in this business at a very young age, but lost more than 10 years due to my first film being stolen and unfinished. The last decade did not go to waste though. I made a plan for how I would make my next film and now I'm executing it. With your support we can make this film a reality.
Summer in Latvia does not last long and we must shoot much of the film during this period. Our goal for this campaign is the absolute minimum we need to get the film "in the can". We certainly intend to raise more than our goal! We hope to raise enough money to fund the entire shoot and all of post production.
We are able to dramatically cut the cost of making the film because we own our own RED Scarlet-X camera, lenses, audio gear and some lighting. There really will not be much that needs to be rented. Also, in addition to producing and directing the film, I am shooting and editing and will be handling at least some of the visual effects work myself.
We plan to make a "photomosiac" movie poster using photos of all our backers. There will be a printable PDF of the finished poster available online for you to download. Once our project is funded we will send everyone that backed our film a request for a personal photo. The example above was quickly made to illustrate the concept. The finished poster will be professionally done and on par with anything you would see at the cinema, with just one exception: you will be on it! 
Take a good look at the Rewards section to the right for the details. Below is an overview of what you can get for backing us.
Your photo on the above mentioned poster.
A "shout out" on Twitter (250k+ followers) and Facebook.
Digital Download of the film.
DVD copy of the film.
Blu-ray copy of the film.
Our Twitter marketing secrets (we didn't get 250k followers by accident).
Our Kickstarter marketing strategy.
One of a kind collectible props from the film.
A walk on role in the film.
Your commercial/video featured on our DVD, Blu-ray and website.
Your logo on our film poster and in the end credits.
Associate Producer credit.
Executive producer credit.
Co-production credit.
Free Rewards
Most campaigns offer "Backer Only" video or blog updates. We don't want to restrict anyone from following along as we make the film. You all get access. 
Have a short film? Send a Tweet to your Twitter followers with the link to our Kickstarter page and we will RT your short film to all our 250k followers.
We will choose the short film we like the best and offer to include it in the "New Talent" section of the Hybrid Vigor DVD/Blu-ray when it's released. This is something we want to do for all our films.
4 Things
First make a donation of any size. You can change your donation amount anytime before the campaign ends and you will not be charged anything unless we meet our fundraising goal.
After you back us and completed your transaction, Kickstarter will give you the option to send a message out to your friends/followers on social media sites like Twitter and Facebook. The message will say you just backed us and it will included a link to our project page (you can edit the text). Please send these messages! It only takes a second and will help tremendously!
Find at least one other person to make a donation. Even if it's just $1 they can get their photo on our movie poster. $5 and they get their name in the credits too!
Know that you seriously rock! Your donation goes a long way towards helping us achieve our dreams. We sincerely appreciate it!
..
...

Shortly after that, one of the main actors in the film needed serious medical treatment, and it took several months for them to recover. The important thing is they are alright now. Unfortunately, I’m not.
We were exploring the Latvian countryside the other day looking for a location for a couple scenes. Ended up finding this deserted Soviet era military city.

campaign.story:
Z4 is a new Orchestronic album that I have been working hard to bring to life.  This album will hopefully prove that I have something to offer the music world.

I have released 2 other albums in 2008 and 2010 that didn't do so well, but I strive to keep getting better every day and I have improved an immense amount since then!
I plan on releasing the Z4 album on February 7th, 2013 and a free EP in October 2012. The album will consist of 14- 16 songs and the EP will have at least 5 songs.
I have been able to gather my equipment so far with my own funds, however lately my funds have run dry due to various schooling debts and moving debts. So just like every young dude with a passion, I am out of money and full of motivation to make awesome stuff! Now I did recently land a better paying job so I can finally get my debts payed off in the next 2-3 years, but I really don't plan on waiting another 2-3 years for this album to hit peoples eardrums. So that is why I would like to kickstart the Z4 album into fruition!
Here are some samples of what I have been working on. Keep in mind that the quality of music that is produced only gets even better if this project is funded!
Main Goal: Reach $5000 to pay for everything on the A List.
You might be asking, what is my current music studio setup?  Well here is the answer, this is stuff I have acquired over the past 5 years.
Desktop PC (mostly for my day job)
FL-studio
East West Quantum leap Ministry of Rock and Symphonic Orchestra Gold Edition
ReFX Nexus 2
Blue Yeti Microphone
Yamaha DGX 505 Keyboard (Glorified Midi Controller)
A Items (Items I need to have in order to finish the album at all)
ReFX Nexus2 Expansions
Omicron 1 2 and 3 Expansions
Stratosphere 1 and 2 Expansions
Sounds Online Complete Composers Collection
Album Mastering
Album Registration
CD Duplication
Advertising
B Items: Will be shown if I reach the main goal.
C Items: Will be shown if I reach the main goal.
Premium Shirts are made from better materials, Normal shirts are 100% Preshrunk Cotton, (Details in the Updates)
Basic Stuff:  CD's, T-Shirts, High Fives, Distribution Packages
Abnormal Stuff: Cardboard Keyboard, Sky Diving Video

Unique Stuff:
     VIP Access Perks:
Weekly Updates and Progress Reports!
Listen and Download the latest Work in Progress Tracks
Listen and Download almost all of my previous tracks.
Comment on every track and give your input.
Exclusive Bonus Track when the next album releases.
Discount on the physical CD.
Full Digital Download of the Z4 Album.
     Unlimited VIP Access Perks:
All of the normal VIP access Perks.
No expiration date for your account (Others expire a month after Z4 releases).
     Ultra VIP Access Perks
All of the VIP Access and Unlimited VIP access Perks.
Download All 24bit Waveform MultiTrack files for each song on the Z4 album for remix/remastering purposes. You must confirm with me before you sell anything with those files.
     Ultra VIP Access + Source File Perks
All VIP Access, Unlimited VIP Access, and Ultra VIP Access Perks
Download All Source Files (Fruity Loops or Pro Tools depending on which program I am using) for your educational, remixing, remastering purposes only. You must get my permission to earn a profit off of the songs you make using these files.
And here is the making of the kickass wave power keyboard featured in the main video!
I appreciate everything that you all potentially could end of doing to help kick my music career up a notch or two!
Last but not least.
A special thanks to a buddy of mine Steve Ross for helping me out with some of the ideas and the video!
